Belmira, 57, is noted for her great kindness and for the effort she puts into her activities to get ahead.  She’s married and has four adult children.  She lives in her own house with her children and grandchildren.  She works hard to earn income needed to improve her quality of life for her family’s benefit.

Belmira’s main activity is selling fish.  She rises very early every day to head to her city’s small fishing port to buy the best, fresh, good-size fish.  When she has all the fish, she separates them by species and size, determines a fair price and sets them up on a table she has in her market stand.  She’s been in this business for more than 40 years and it’s her only source of income.  She always works alone and works all morning.  She affirms that sometimes she feels like she’s taken some step backwards because of the intense, suffocating morning heat.  However, she knows that she has to work to meet her needs.

She’s now considered the possibility of selling bananas because she insists that they are the best nutritional accompaniment for fish and also because her own customers are requesting said product.  To do so, she needs to have the necessary capital and get to work.

This is her fifth MFP loan and she’s very at ease because of the great support she’s getting because she feels that she will provide family, economic and personal progress this way; she will emerge with more self-confidence.  

She is grateful for the support she’s gotten from her group and for all the advice her advisor has provided.  This motivates her to continue striving to make all her installment payments punctually.

The requested 1,500 sol loan is to buy fish and several bunches of bananas.  Her daily investment can be up to 200 soles depending on market prices since the wholesale price of these products may vary.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy more clothes of better quality to restock her shop. This purchase will help her to do a better job of meeting the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of clothing. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to enlarge her store and increase her sales, and thus will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more clothes of better quality to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат женщина в возрасте  52 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Она учительница в местной школе. Кредитуется в нашей организации с 2009 г. и ни разу не нарушала условия кредитования, а также показала себя с хорошей стороны. В течении кредитования  Адолат женила старшего сына. Проводила мероприятия по поводу рождения внуков. Очередной кредит хочет получить на предстоящую свадьбу своей  дочери. По нашим  традициям родители невесты должны купить приданное, поэтому она на полученный кредит планирует купить подарки для невесты. Муж Адолат работает в кирпичном заводе и вместе с сыном помогают ей по хозяйству. Она благодарна нашей организации за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Adolat is a woman of 52 years. She is married and has two children. She is a teacher at the local school. She has been a client of our organization since 2009 and has not once violated the loan terms, and has shown herself from a very good side. 

At the time of the previous loan, Adolat married away her eldest son. She hosted an event at the birth of her grandson. This next loan she wants to take for the upcoming wedding of her daughter. In our traditions, the bride's parents should pay dowry, and for this reason she plans to use the loan received to purchase gifts for the bride. 

Adolat's husband works at a brickyard and together with their son helps her in the house. She is thankful to our organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy gifts for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Jinson Vicente

texts.es:
JINSON VICENTE tiene 31 años es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La ventanilla se llama CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Jesus del Gran Poder, pertenece al canton Ventanas, se dedica a labores agricolas. 

JINSON VICENTE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, guineo y naranja. Solicita el credito para comprarce una camioneta. La compra la realizará en  Ventanas. 

Con la yauda del crédito podrá completar el dinero para comprar la camioneta que tanta falta le hace para transportar los productos.

El sueño de Jinson es comprar una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte con su familia.

"Esta muy agradecido por el anterior crédito".
texts.en:
Jinson Vicente is 31 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his wife and his children in the city of Ventanas, in De Los Rios province. He is a member of the "Caminando Hacia el Futuro" communal bank, located in the rural settlement of Jesús del Gran Poder, which is part of Ventanas canton, and an area where people make their living from agriculture.

Jinson Vicente is a farmer, and grows cacao, bananas, and oranges. He is applying for the loan in order to buy a truck. He will purchase it in Ventanas. 

With the help of the loan, he will be able to put together the money to buy the truck he so much needs for transporting his crops.

Jinson's dream is to buy a house. In his spare time he likes to play sports with his family.

"I am very grateful for the previous loan," he says.

loans.use: para comprarce una camioneta

loans.name: Lisbeth Karina

texts.es:
Lisbeth es una joven de 18 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Lizbeth no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero espera poder hacerlo muy pronto, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de una amistad, Lizbeth trabaja como vendedora de calzado, ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio donde vende zapatos, zapatillas, sandalias, entre otros, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 11 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño.
Lisbeth se encuentra agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus trabajos ya que en muy poco tiempo iniciará sus estudios profesionales de Enfermería, así ella espera poder seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder culminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios y así lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is an eighteen-year-old young woman who lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person, and she strives to better herself. Unfortunately, due to limited financial resources and because she has to work to help her parents, Lisbeth hasn't been able to go to school and pursue a professional career as a nurse, which is what she wanted. However, she hopes to do so very soon. In her spare time she enjoys dancing and sometimes she makes a very delicious ceviche to share with her family.

Through much effort, dedication, and the support of a friend, Lisbeth works as a shoe saleswoman. She has a small business where she sells shoes, slippers, sandals, and other items for men, women, and children. She can work approximately eleven hours a day and believes it is going well for her due to her good performance. 

Lisbeth is grateful to Kiva lenders because the help provided will allow her to purchase a computer, which will be very useful for her to write papers, since she will be starting nursing school shortly. She hopes she will be able to keep working and striving to earn her degree so that she can make her dreams of becaming a good professional and owning a home come true.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Antonia es miembro del grupo Mujeres Rumbo al Progreso
Antonia tiene 49 años. Ella es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos, actualmente vive con toda su familia y junto a su esposo tratan de sostener su hogar. Antonia tiene un puesto de verduras en un mercado de su zona, son muchos años que trabaja en su negocio vendiendo toda clase de tubérculos, hortalizas y verduras frescas. Su trabajo le ha permitido ayudar en la educación de sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, tanto su esposo como ella se apoyan mutuamente por que desean darle lo mejor a sus hijos, gracias a sus préstamos han podido surgir y mejorar su puesto de verduras; en esta oportunidad usó el préstamo para abastecer su puesto con productos como papas, yucas, camotes, habas y todo tipo de verduras; las cuales compra al por mayor. En el futuro desea  comprar otro puesto en el mercado donde pueda trabajar junto a su esposo.
Antonia agradece el apoyo de los inversionistas que le permiten mejorar tanto a ella como a su grupo. 
*La Sra. Antonia se encuentra en el centro de la foto con polo naranja y un chaleco azul.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Mujeres Rumbo al Progreso (Women on the Way to Progress) Communal Bank.

Antonia is 49 years old. She lives with her life partner and she has 6 children. She currently lives with all her family and together with her husband they strife to provide for their household. Antonia owns a stall in the market of her area where she sells vegetables, an activity she has been engages in for many years, selling every kind of tubers, vegetables and fresh greeneries. Through her job she has been able to help paying for the education of her children and to improve her house. Her husband and herself mutually help each other out, wanting to offer the best to their children. Thanks to the loans she has succeeded in progressing and in making improvements to her vegetable stall. In this occasion she is requesting a loan to supply her stall with products buy buying them at wholesale prices in order to stock up her activity. In the future she plans on buying another stall in the market to work there together with her husband.
Antonia is grateful for the support received by the lenders, as thanks to them both herself and her group can succeeded in improving.

*In the picture Antonia is wearing an orange shirt and a blue jacket.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and vegetables to stock her stand

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as food and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc would like to take a further loan to buy ingredients to make her own drinks and buy more kinds of beverages to sell from her stall. 

Ngoc's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her own drinks as well as to purchase many other kinds of soft drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mariana Teresa

texts.es:
MARIANA TERESA tiene 48 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO, SE ENCUENMTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO JESUS DEL GRAN PODER, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

 MARIANA TERESA Se dedica a labores agrícolas, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono organico. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra y mejoraría el nivel económico.

El sueño es comprarce tierras para agrandar las siembras. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas.

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo.

"Esta muy agradecido por el crédito anterior".
texts.en:
Mariana Teresa is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and her children in the city of Ventanas, in De Los Rios province. She is a member of the "Caminando Hacia el Futuro" communal bank, located in the rural settlement of Jesús del Gran Poder, which is part of Ventanas canton, and  an area where people make their living from agriculture. 

Mariana Teresa farms, and also raises chickens and pigs.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy seeds, urea fertilizer, insecticides, herbicide, and manure.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the necessary fertilizers for planting, and would improve her financial circumstances.

Her dream is to buy land for expanding her plantings. The challenges she faces are crop pests.

In her free time she likes to go for walks.

"I am very grateful for the previous loan," she says.

loans.use: To buy seeds, urea fertilizer, insecticides, herbicide, and manure.

loans.name: Stalyn Heriberto

texts.es:
STALYN HERIBERTO tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

STALYN HERIBERTO Se dedica a labores agrícolas a la siembra de maíz, cacao. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea y la instaslación de riego para cacao. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra.

 El sueño es comprarse una finca. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es comprarse un carro.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Stalyn Heriberto is 22 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios province.  His residence is in the neighborhood of San Gabriel, in Ventanas canton. Stalyn Heriberto belongs to the “24th of September” VCR [communal bank]. He is a farmer and a fisherman.

Stalyn Heriberto grows corn and cacao. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, and urea, and to install an irrigation system for his cacao. With the help of the loan, he will acquire the fertilizers he needs for sowing crops.

Stalyn Heriberto's dream is to buy a farm. The challenges he confronts includes purchasing a car. 

In his free time, he likes to play ball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers,and urea; also, to install irrigation for his cacao grove.

loans.name: Shirlita

texts.en:
Shirlita is 53 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Shirlita has a store that sells a variety of products: soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Pesos to buy additional inventory for sale.

Shirlita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to own a house and lot.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for a soft drinks supply business.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a 41-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be an honest and determined woman.

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. Her business is located at a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the grocery business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. 

Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and use her profits for her family’s financial expenses. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le would like to take a further loan to buy better cakes and foods to sell from her stall. Le's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cakes and foods to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old, married to Kingi and blessed with eight children that she supports. She has run a money transfer service shop for the last eight years, and her monthly income is 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

Esther has applied for a business loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to put up another money transfer shop in the town so that she can meet the demand of her customers.

She intends to use anticipated profits to expand her business to other markets. Her future dream is to have a stable business, educate her children and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to open another money transfer shop.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en:
Phuoc is 36 years old and is married with a son. His wife does housework and takes care of their son. 

Phuoc has been running a business of processing spare parts for five years. He started this business to cover his expenses and to generate income to raise his child. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more materials to increase his production of spare parts. He hopes that this will enable him to increase the turnover in his business. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to make machine spare parts.

loans.name: Tamila

texts.en:
Tamila is from the village of Martkopi. She is 50 years old and lives with her husband. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They are involved in the animal husbandry business and have two calves and two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. 

Tamila sells the dairy products from her house. Besides, she works as an accountant at the local school and her husband is a driver in a private company. Both of them get a monthly salary.

Tamila requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in the agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs. The living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married with two children. Alma is 31 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.

Alma is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Alma has been doing this for three years. Alma has requested a loan to purchase additional piglets and feeds. 

Alma has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Alma hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Don Víctor tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive en una aldea de Baracoa, Cortes.
Don Víctor siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de plátano. El tiene cultivo en la zona de producción y también en su casa. Hace 26 años que realiza esta actividad y la producción la vende en el mercado local y a sus alrededores. Este negocio ha sido su fuente de ingresos. don Víctor lleva cuatro ciclos de préstamos con ODEF, el que solicita actualmente es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara en la compra de abonos para el cultivo de plátano, para mejorar la producción y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es seguir trabajando con sus cultivos para mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Victor, 49, is married and has six children; he lives in a village in Baracoa, Cortes.  He’s always worked in agriculture, specifically growing bananas.  He grows them in the farm zone and also at home.  He’s been in this activity for 26 years and he sells his production in the local market and in nearby areas.  This business is his source of income.  

Victor has been in four ODEF cycles and the one he’s currently requesting is for 6,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy manure for his banana plants to improve production and increase sales.  His goal is to continue working with his crops to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure for his banana plants.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Hong, 30 years old, is married and has a daughter. Her husband works in a restaurant. She supports her family through the income she earns from making and selling steamed rolled rice pancakes. She began this business five years ago. Her family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hong intends to take a loan to buy good quality rice and ingredients to make better pancakes. The additional capital will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice and ingredients for making steamed rolled rice pancakes for selling.

loans.name: Las Malvinas Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Peru! La Sra. Susana es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Las Malvinas”, un grupo conformado por 10 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Susana se dedica a la venta de comida en un  puesto que esta situado en su casa, Susana trabaja desde hace 9 años, a su vez se dedica a la venta de zapato y prendas de vestir, y las prendas y zapatos los vende en provincia , con el tiempo cuenta con clientes fidelizados y su negocio sigue creciendo.
 
Susana ha solicitado el préstamo  para comprar prendas de vestir para aumentar su mercaderia. Su sueño es un día tener un puesto propio, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

Susana es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, Susana ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos sus hijos tuvieron educacion y sobre todo cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida. Susana está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva.


L
texts.en: Greetings from Peru!  Susana’s a member of the “Las Malvinas” communal bank, a group of ten members who carry out a variety of commercial activities.  Susana sells food in a stand located at home. She’s been in business for nine years.  At the same time, she also sells shoes and clothes in outlying areas.  She’s gained a regular clientele in time and her business continues growing.  Susana has requested the loan to buy clothes and increase her merchandise.  Her dream is to have her own stand someday in order to provide better customer service.  Susana’s married and has three children.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she’s earned higher income and her children obtained an education.  Above all, they have better quality of life.  Susana is very happy with this loan and is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es: Don Jose tiene 68 años de edad, vive en una aldea que pertenece a Baracoa, Cortes junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. El señor Jose en toda su vida ha sido agricultor, tiene aproximadamente 35 años de dedicarse a los cultivos de plátano y cultivo de palma africana. La producción es de plátano y fruta de palma que sirve para sacar el aceite vegetal. La producción de plátano la vende en los mercados locales y la fruta de palma la vende en los centros de acopio de la zona. El préstamo que solicita es el quinto ciclo y lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para darle mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos con el fin de mejorar el desarrollo de la plantación y aumentar la producción. Tiene como meta ampliar sus cultivos de palma para obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 68 years old. He lives in a village that is part of Baracoa, in Cortés department, together with his wife and his three children. José has been a farmer his entire life, and has been growing plantain and African palm for around 35 years. 

He produces plantain, as well as palm fruit, which is used to extract vegetable oil. He sells his plantain in the local markets, and sells the palm fruit to the collection centers in the area.

The loan he is applying for is his fifth, and he will use it to buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies, in order to maintain and assist his crops. His aim is to improve the growth of his plantation and increase output.

His goal is to expand his palm cultivation, so that he can earn greater income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies for maintaining his plantain and African palm plantation.

loans.name: Afzal

texts.ru: Афзал житель города Истаравшан. Ему 22 года. Афзал женат. У него двое детей. Жена Афзала домохозяйка. Афзал предоставляет услугу, такси. Он занимается частным извозом. В этой области Афзал два года. Он просит кредит для ремонта своей легковой автомашины.
texts.en:
Afzal is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. He is 22 years old, and married. He has two children. Azfal's wife is a housewife. 

Afzal provides a taxi service. He is a private taxi driver. He has been working in this area for two years. Azfal requests a loan for repair of his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Yemny Lidis

texts.es:
Yemny es una mujer de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus pequeños, ya que ella es madre y padre para ellos, gracias a su esfuerzo Yemny estudió la carrera profesional de Educación, lamentablemente por diversas razones no pudo ejercer su profesión, en sus ratos libres le gusta trabajar y en algunas ocasiones engríe a sus pequeños invitándolos a comer un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Yemny trabaja brindando atención al cliente en un grifo de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable y se siente a gusto realizando su labor.
Yemny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el pago de las mensualidades de la educación de sus pequeños; de esta manera Yemny espera asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus hijos, ya que ella desea que sus pequeños sean unos buenos profesionales y tengan un mejor futuro que ella, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su sueño de tener su casa propia y un pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Yemny, 35, lives in Ica with her two children who she loves and are her main reason for living.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all her efforts into moving her little ones forward because she’s both mother and father for them. 

Thanks to her efforts, Yemny studied to be a teacher but due to various reasons was unable to exercise her profession.  She likes to work in her free time and on occasion pampers her little ones treating them to delicious charcoal grilled chicken.

On her own initiative and with much effort and enthusiasm, Yemny works providing customer service at a local gas station.  She starts work every day very early in the morning and can work about 8 hours daily.  She believes she does well because she’s very responsible and feels good doing her work.

Yemny is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to pay her children’s monthly tuition fees.  She hopes this way to insure her children’s education and wellbeing because she wants her little ones to become good professionals and to have a better future than she’s had and she will continue working and striving to reach her dream of owning a house and a small business.

loans.use: to pay her children's monthly tuition fees.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu, 56, is married and has three children, two son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a painter for hire.

Thu has been selling soft drinks in front of her house for ten years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different beverages to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 37, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She earns an income running a fruit-selling shop. 

She started this business five years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of fruits to sell at her store to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions

loans.use: To buy many kinds of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Enakiz

texts.ru: Энакиз женщина, ей 68 лет. Она замужем  имеет пятерых детей и двоих внучек .  В нашей организации кредитуется более 9 лет. Много лет она занимается этим бизнесом и она очень любить свою работу. Энакиз начинала свой бизнес с мелкой торговли но на данной момент её бизнес значительно расширился.     Муж помогает ей в реализации бизнеса и кроме этого частично занимается плотничеством.  Энакиз покупает товар с города  и реализует его на местном рынке своего села. Она очень ответственная, добросовестная, пунктуальная и не разу не нарушала политику организации. На полученный кредит хочет закупить женскую одежду. Она выражает свою благодарность организациям таким как Арванд.
texts.en: Enakiz is a 68 year-old woman.  She is married and has five children and two granddaughters.  She has been obtaining financing from our organization fro over nine years.  She has been involved in this business for many years and loves her work very much.  Enakiz started her business with small sales, but her business has expanded significantly since then.  Her husband helps her with the business and is also involved in carpentry work part-time.  Enakiz buys merchandise from the city and sells it at a local market in her village.  She is very responsible, conscientious and punctual and never violated the terms of the organization.  She wants to purchase women's clothing with this loan.  She expresses her gratitude to organizations like Arvand.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, supplies, containers and disposable packaging.

loans.name: Talia Annele

texts.es:
Talia es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Talia se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración, en sus ratos libres le gusta explorar en internet y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de una amistad, Talia trabaja como secretaria en una empresa de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana asiste a su centro de trabajo para iniciar su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amble que brinda a los demás.
Talia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de sus materiales de estudio, tales como libros, folletería y separatas; de esta manera Talia desea seguir cursando sus estudios satisfactoriamente, para así convertirse en un buena profesional y espera lograr su sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Talía, 21, lives in Ica with her parents and siblings.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Thanks to her effort and to her parents’ help, Talía is studying business administration.  In her free time she enjoys surfing the Internet and on occasion cooks a delicious Ceviche [marinated seafood cocktail] to share with her family.

With much effort and enthusiasm and with support from an acquaintance, Talía is working as a secretary in a local firm.  She heads to her workplace very early in the morning every day to start her work.  She works about 10 hours daily and believes she does well because of her good work and the kind way she treats others.

Talía is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy study materials like textbooks, pamphlets and offprints so that she can continue with her courses satisfactorily and become a good professional and reach her dream of owning her own house.

loans.use: to buy study materials like textbooks, pamphlets and offprints.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 33 years old and single. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a stall selling coffee, beverages and fruit juice to earn a living. She started her business five years ago. 

Thuy intends to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of different beverages to sell from her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract new customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is married to Emily and together they have three children. He operates a second-hand clothing shop in Narok area and has been running the business for three years earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. He is 37 years old.

Sammy was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend who is also a registered client of KADET. He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., with which he intends to purchase more clothing for sale in the coming high season. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for his school-going children. His dream is to improve his living standards and own a residential plot

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: C7817 Abakundakurima Group

texts.en:
Desire is 49 years old and is married with four children aged between nine and 25 years old. He is the leader of this group, which is called "C7817 ABAKUNDAKURIMA" in the local language. In the photo, he's the one who is lifting his hand. He works from 7 a.m. to 1 p.m. every workday except the weekend. He has five years of experience and he currently employs six people to help him. 

Desire has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his rice agriculture by buying more fertilizer. This way he hopes to sell more rice. With the profits expected from this loan, he will be able to pay school fees for his children, to renovate his house and to provide food more easily for his family.

loans.use: To expand his rice agriculture by buying more fertilizer.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married with 10 children. Alicia is 45 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Alicia sells snack food to earn a living and had this business for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Alicia is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Luneta

texts.en:
Luneta is 43 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 

Luneta is engaged in farming and earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to be used in redeeming mortgaged coconut land. 

Luneta has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Luneta hopes to engage in other type of business.

loans.use: To be used in redeeming mortgaged coconut land.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 27-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as an intelligent and focused man. He operates a retail store where he sells green maize. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be outbreak of infectious disease that affects the maize when sprouting. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy green maize to sell. His business goal is to venture into farming a cash crop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bags of green maize to sell.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru: Насим занимается продажей и перевозкой строительных материалов на  грузовой автомашине - такси. Он продает   различные товары, например: трубы, арматуры и строительные материалы и развозит их   в дальние районы и сельские места . Его жена также имеет доход, она работает в колхозе  фермером, также  ухаживает за сельскохозяйственными культурами.  У него трое взрослых детей, они не где не работают.  На  полученный  кредит Насим  хочет  приобрести  арматуры, так как у него есть заказ на этот товар. Заранее благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Nasim is involved in selling and transporting construction materials in a truck-taxi.  He sells various goods, such as pipes, fixtures and construction materials, and transports them to remote districts and rural areas.  His wife also has an income - she works as a farmer at a collective farm and takes care of agricultural crops.  He has three adult children, who do not work anywhere.  Nasim wants to use this loan to purchase fixtures because he has an order for this type of merchandise.  He is grateful in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fixtures

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina lives in the village of Makhinjauri in the Adjara region of Georgia. She is 51 years old, married and lives with her husband, mother-in-law, daughter and a son-in-law. Irina’s mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension.

Irina is a baker. Her job takes a lot of time and energy, but she still finds time for the family’s business. Irina’s family has a milk cow, whose milk is used for cheese products and sold locally. They also have a citrus garden and a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Irina sells the agricultural products at the local open market.

As their existing income isn’t enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor, Irina’s husband decided to work as a taxi driver using his own car. With the requested loan Irina plans to purchase a car. According to family’s estimations they will get approximately 600 GEL additional monthly income. The increased income will allow the family to increase their spending and so improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for use as a taxi.

loans.name: Parvona

texts.ru: Парвона очень умная и целеустремленная девушка. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. В настоящее время она студентка 3 курса Медицинского колледжа. Она учится отлично и очень активно участвует во всех мероприятиях колледжа. Ее родители простые рабочие и получают маленькую зарплату. Они не в состоянии оплатить за учебы Правоны в колледже. Парвона запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в колледже. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Parvona is a very smart and goal-oriented young woman.  She is 21 years old, single and lives with her parents.  She is currently a third-year student at the Medical college.  She studies with excellence and actively participates in all of the college events.  Her parents are simple workers and earn a small salary.  They cannot pay for Parvona's college education.  Parvona is requesting this loan to pay for her college education.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her college education

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old, married to Stephen and a mother of two school-going children. She is employed and earns KES 13,000 monthly. To make an additional KES 10,000 a month, she operates a water sale business in Mongare area in Narok county. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. She plans to use it to purchase a cart and donkey to transport water. The proceeds will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children. 

She hopes to be financially stable and own her own residential plot in future.

loans.use: to purchase a cart and donkey to transport water.

loans.name: Lidia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Microempresaria de éxito emprendedora ella es Lidia mujer de 42 años de edad  que se dedica a comercializar y vender ropa, cosméticos y productos plásticos desde 6 años, la socia trabaja en grupo solidario donde lleva 14 préstamos y  por mantener su record crediticio es beneficiada por un crédito Mujer que consiste en que el cliente lo invierte en gastos personales como compra de medicamentos, exámenes de laboratorios de rutina, chequeos médicos, sala de belleza etc.

El crédito lo invertirá en gastos personales como chequeo médico, exámenes de laboratorio de rutina, y compra de medicamentos.
texts.en:
Lidia, 42, is a successful entrepreneur and micro-business owner. She has worked selling clothing, cosmetics, and plastic goods for six years. She works in a solidarity group where she has taken out 14 loans. For maintaining her good credit record, she is receiving a "crédito Mujer" (Woman Loan), which means she can invest the loan in personal expenses like buying medicines, routine lab exams, medical checkups, beauty salon, etc. 

She will invest the loan in personal expenses like a medical checkup, routine lab exams, and purchasing medicines.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses like routine exams, medicines, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for a grocery selling business.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients and raw food to make good meals to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase good quality food to sell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 42 years old, and is single. She has been running a stall selling breads for three years. She started this business to cover her expenses. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Phuong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and quality of ingredients and breads to sell from her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and breads to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 38 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez. Faith is married with three children. To earn a living, Faith has a business selling snacks in the community. Faith earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Faith has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.  

Faith has been a member of PMPC for a year.  In the future,Faith would like to earn additional income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is a 64-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. For three years, she has run a general store selling household items and personal-use products for people in her community.

Ngan would like a loan to purchase better quality products at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, soaps, sanitation items and other things to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hotdogs to resell.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LA FORTALEZA  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,   la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Yamile tiene 43 años, es casada tiene cinco  hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra su propio domicilio,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Yamile  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de de insumos como arroz, fideo y papa por mayor  para la elaboración de sus platillos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de platillos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Yamile va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Yamile es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship bank, LA FORTALEZA, is made up of eight members: seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Yamile. She is 43 and married with five school-aged children. She works selling food at her food stand which is in her home. This loan is her third from the institution. Yamile will use this loan to buy ingredients like rice, noodles, and potatoes wholesale, in order to make her dishes. This way, she will be able to offer a greater variety of dishes to her customers. Her reason for asking for this loan is to keep improving her business. Yamile will use the gains to continue buying ingredients and that way keep improving her income. 

Yamile is a very hardworking person. She is very glad for the opportunity given to her. In many cases, her companions in the group are the only ones supporting their families.

loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale, like rice, noodles, and potatoes.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 42 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with them and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a scooter rider for hire.

She has run a beauty salon at her house for 26 years. She intends to use her loan to buy some hair dressing tools and cosmetic products to meet her customer's needs.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy hair dressing tools and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Xinh

texts.en:
Xinh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.


She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a twenty-eight-year-old farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya where she lives with her husband and four children who are all attending school. She has been in farming for five years, producing milk and eggs which she sells to the people in her local area. She plans to start selling cereals in the near future as an additional income.

She is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry and materials to construct a zero grazing unit which will help her increase her production. Hence she will get more income which will help her pay her children's school fees with some ease.

Poor infrastructure, poor rainfall, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming. 

She says Juhudi Kilimo staff are very reliable.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and materials for building a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Khanh hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of general goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Ngoc hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a range of different general store products to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en:
Tinh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

Tinh hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock his general store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 48 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban. Regina is married with 3 children. 

To earn a living, Regina has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.
  
Regina has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, she  would like to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 23 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene una hija vive con la hija y la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

Juan Carlos  se dedica a la siembra de maíz en terrenos propios y una parte arrendados, el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, fungicidas, ranger, líquido mata maleza para evitar las enfermedades. 

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El crédito le ha apoyado para seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura. El sueño es contar con buena salud para seguir trabajando con la ayuda de la esposa. En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 23 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has a daughter. He lives with his daughter and wife in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. He is a member of Ventanilla communal bank "24 de Septiembre", which is located in the area of San Gabriel, belonging to Cantón Ventanas. They are engaged to agricultural and livestock jobs.

Juan Carlos is engaged to planting corn, in his own plots and also in rented plots. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds, fungicides, Ranger and weed killer to prevent diseases. The purchases will be made in the city of Ventanas. 

The loan will support him to continue investing in agriculture. His dream is to have good health to continue working with the help of his wife. In his spare time, he likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fungicides, Ranger and weed killer.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and material. Yen's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and material.

loans.name: Nouh

texts.en: This is Nouh, a 26 year old engaged man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. Nouh’s father is the one taking care of the family and satisfying their needs.  Nouh as well strives to work really hard and doesn’t hesitate to offer help whenever needed. He has owned a grocery store in his town since 2009 and has clients from all over the neighboring villages who pass by his shop to purchase their needs of food and provisions. He succeeded at work especially after being very welcoming and friendly. Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy supplementary products for his business such as candies, dairy products, canned/bottled foods, and many other items. He’s sure that by diversifying his products, his sales will increase by minimum 20%. This is how Nouh works to better develop his business.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products for his business such as candies, dairy products, canned/bottled foods, and many other items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is widowed with one child. She is 67 years old and lives in Tipan,Sinacaban.

Elizabeth is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional inorganic and commercial fertilizers.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to earn as additional income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Tien's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. 

He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials

loans.name: Margarita Elena

texts.es:
En una lucha por conservar su identidad india, la cultura Otavaleña ha mantenido sus costumbres en idioma, vestimenta y labores. A esta cultura pertenece Margarita, emprendedora como toda su gente, tiene 26 años es soltera, aprobó la educación secundaria y vive con sus padres. Viven juntos en la Parroquia San Rafael que se encuentra en el Cantón Otavalo de la Provincia de Imbabura. Otavalo es una ciudad muy atractiva por la diversidad de su cultura por lo que es muy concurrida por turistas nacionales y extranjeros quienes en cada visita disfrutan de paisajes, fiestas coloridas y las costumbres de sus habitantes indígenas y mestizos que provienen de legendarias historias y que han defendido su territorio desde siempre. Es un cantón muy rico económicamente pues desde sus antecedentes ancestrales, fue considerado el centro de la industria artesanal y actualmente estos productos son cotizados en todo el mundo.  También el turismo es una industria que aporta a la economía de esta ciudad, pues en la zona rural se pueden encontrar ríos, lagos, cascadas, bosques que son muy visitados. Por la afluencia de turistas, comerciantes y habitantes de la ciudad, en el centro de la ciudad se puede encontrar gran variedad de negocios que tienen el objetivo brindar todos los servicios para quienes pasan por la ciudad, estos negocios varían entre hoteles, hostales, restaurantes, cafeterías, papelerías, tiendas de ropa, alquiler de computadores, internet, etc. 
Margarita, aprendió de sus abuelos y padres a elaborar esteras, ventiladores y varios productos elaborados con paja de forma artesanal. Lleva en este negocio 7 años y lo realiza de forma ambulante en el centro de la ciudad para llamar la atención de turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Invierte al menos 8 horas cada día en la elaboración y venta de estos productos. Uno de sus sueños es convertirse en una microempresaria de éxito y dar a conocer en todo el mundo estos bienes artesanales que forman parte importante de su cultura. Como primer paso Margarita quiere rentar un local en el que pueda ofrecer su mercadería y al mismo tiempo se dedique a la elaboración de estas artesanías, para lo cual ha asumido la responsabilidad de solicitar un crédito en donde además pueda aprender sobre la adecuada administración de su negocio. Fundación Alternativa cuyo objetivo es acabar con la pobreza en el país, brindó el apoyo a Margarita y ella asegura que su estilo de vida mejorará con el incremento de ingresos por las ventas que realizará en su nuevo local.
texts.en:
Struggling to preserve their culture and identity, the Otavalo Indians have maintained their customary language, clothing, and crafts. Margarita belongs to this culture. Like the rest of her people, she is full of drive. She is 26 years old and single. She finished high school and lives with her parents in San Rafael parish, which is in Otavalo Canton, province of Imbabura. 

Otavalo is a very attractive city due to its diverse culture. It is highly visited by domestic and foreign tourists who enjoy the landscape, the colorful celebrations, and the traditions of its indigenous and mestizo peoples with legendary history and who have always defended their territory. The economy in this canton is very wealthy because even in its ancient past it was considered the center of the handycraft industry and currently these products are valued all over the world. Tourism is another industry that supports this city's economy, because in its rural areas you can find rivers, lakes, waterfalls, and forests that are highly visited. Because of the affluence of tourists, merchants, and townspeople, downtown you can find a great variety of businesses that seek to offer all kinds of services to anyone passing through the city: hotels, inns, restaurants, cafes, news stands, boutiques, Internet cafes and booths, etc. 

Margarita learned how to make mats, fans, and several items out of straw from her grandparents and parents, using traditional methods. She has been in this business for seven years and she works on the streets downtown in order to draw attention from domestic and foreign tourists. She invests at least eight hours a day in making and selling her products. One of her dreams is to become a successful microentrepreneur and show the whole world these traditional crafts which are an important part of her culture. As a first step, Margarita wants to rent a location where she can set up her merchandise for sale and at the same time make her crafts. In order to achieve this, she has taken on the responsibility of requesting a loan. She also wants to learn about how to adequately manage a business. 

Fundación Alternativa, whose goal it is to erradicate poverty throughout the country, has offered Margarita support, and she assures that her living standards will improve thanks to the increased income she will obtain from sales made at her new shop.

loans.use: to rent a shop where she can offer her products.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
MIGUEL ANGEL tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive la mamá en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

MIGUEL ANGEL Se dedica a labores agrícolas, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono organico. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra y mejoraría el nivel económico.

 El sueño es comprar un terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las cosechas.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is 19 years old, single, and without children. He lives with his mother in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. 

He is a member of the communal bank since the 24th of September. It is located in the community of San Gabriel. 

In the canton of Ventanas, people make a living from agriculture and livestock. 

Miguel Angel earns his living in agriculture, and raising chickens and pigs. 

He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, weed killer, and manure. With the help from this loan, he will be able to buy the fertilizers necessary to sow his fields and improve his income. 

His dream is to buy land. His challenges are infestations of his crops. 

In his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, weed killer, and manure.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business. She has seven children and has been doing this work for 20 years.  

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Dairy farming and horticulture!” Her biggest challenges are “diseases that affect dairy cows and animal feeds.” Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Rubia” and “Maua”.

Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “Because Juhudi Kilimo finances farmers to acquire assets and I wanted to buy a dairy cow.”  

This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: “I was able to learn about the various assets that Juhudi Kilimo finances as a microfinance institution and the usefulness of diversifying agricultural activities.”

Mary’s highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Mary replied, “My children will be able to get school fees through selling of milk and they will also get food.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mary owns the following: cow, poultry, bicycle, but she does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 29-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and three young children who all attend school. His is the main source of income for the family. In 2007, he decided to get involved in the car trading industry. Due to his strong negotiation skills and friendly personality, he was able to succeed in this domain. But his income barely covers the high cost of living--that is why he started to also work in a local company to earn an extra income. Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to perform the needed maintenance on his cars before selling them. He needs to make the cars safe. Abbas is very optimistic and hoping to open his own car showroom in the near future.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his cars before selling them.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh, 38, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns money by selling soft drinks in his store at the front of his house. Binh opened this store eight years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater quantity and variety of soft drinks to sell which will better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married with seven children. She is 74 years old and lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.
Marcelina is a farmer who grow coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of Php 10,000 to redeem her pawned coconut land. 
Marcelina has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Marcelina hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to redeem her pawned coconut land.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is requesting a loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 52 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban. She is married with four children. 
Rosalina has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month. Rosalina has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar and oil. 
Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she would like to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is a 29-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and only child. He has owned a plant nursery since 2002. In parallel, he has worked as a painter for many years to supplement his income and better support his family. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. Today he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase plants and agricultural products to increase his business productivity and therefore his profits. He is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming season and hopes that the loan will help him increase his income by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase plants and agricultural products.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a Lebanese married man. He is 44 years old. He is living with his wife and two school-aged children. He seeks to manage his family’s life and cover his children’s study fees. This is the reason why he started to work really hard to afford the heavy life expenses. 

Four years ago, Haidar started his independent business. He has opened a coffee shop in his town where he also sells candies, chocolate, etc. He has his own loyal customers who always meet at his place to have fun and enjoy time. 

With his requested loan of Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to purchase the needed products for his café such as coffee, glasses, candies, and many other items. This will increase the number of his customers and most probably his revenues. One of his greatest dreams is to collect money and offer his children whatever they want.

loans.use: to purchase the needed products for his café such as coffee, glasses, candies, and many other items.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 30-year-old widow living with her son aged 14 years in a small village near Odisha, India. She owns and manages a tailoring shop where she stitches clothes for her customers, when they place orders for stitching. She stitches 'salwar's, blouses and suits (all are Indian traditional dress) for them. She has one sewing machine in her shop. She has a very good relationship with her customers but she is not able to take orders in large amounts as she has only one sewing machine.

She has a plan to purchase one more sewing machine for her shop and appoint another person as her helper, so that she can take orders in bulk  and satisfy her customers.

Jayanti has applied for a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing a sewing machine, fabric and for appointing a person as her helper in her shop.

She has a dream to have her son study in a good school and save some money for his higher studies.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a sewing machine and fabrics for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Narayan

texts.en:
Narayan is engaged in the activity of repairing electronic items. He repairs televisions, ceiling fans, radios, etc. He has four years of experience in this work. He visits the market for purchasing the repair or spare parts thrice a week and brings only a small quantity home due to lack of funds. He has his shop in his house only which makes it easy for him to manage his family along with his work.

He is a 30-year-old 'differently-able' person living with his wife and a son aged one year. He is a responsible father and does care for his family.

He has requested a loan amount of 35,000 INR for purchasing repair parts like capacitors, coils, registers, tuners, etc. for repairing electronic gadgets in bulk so to avoid very frequent visits to the market and reduce his transportation cost.

Narayan wants to provide all necessities of life to his family and save some money for his son's future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing repair parts like capacitors, coils, registers, tuners, etc. for repairing electronic gadgets.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a 30-year-old single man living with one parent and a sibling. He has owned a barbershop since 2005 where he welcomes customers of different ages with the top quality services. His father provides the primary source of income for the family, and Victor cooperates with him financially to meet their life needs. Today, he is asking for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase hairdressing supplies, such as hair gels and mousse, to sell in his shop. He has high demand for these types of products and Victor always wishes to satisfy his clients. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into other areas and start to serve women for their hairdressing and beauty needs.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing supplies such as hair gels and mousse.

loans.name: Alek

texts.en: Alek is a 37-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents and only sibling. He has owned a car repair shop since 1993 where he performs maintenance on different types of cars internally and externally. His business income is vital for the family. He is supportive of his father. Today, Alek is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase motor oil to better serve his customers. We note that Alek took advantage of his previous Kiva loans and confirms that these loans helped him achieve remarkable growth in a short period of time. He is sure that this loan will also assist him monetarily and allow him expand his business even further.

loans.use: to purchase motor oil.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 30 year old Lebanese divorced man. He lives with his five siblings and parents. He and his siblings cooperate together to be able to help their father, who’s their main income provider, as they all seek to live a proper life. They are responsible for managing the family expenses and enhancing their way of living.

Khoder started his own and independent business in 2008. He works in car trading on a freelance basis upon request. He is looking forward to gaining more clients. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his cars before selling them. He will benefit from this loan by boosting his work, serving a wider range of people and, most importantly, increasing his earnings. 

Khoder is a young and hardworking man, and this will help him achieve his goals in a short period.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his cars before selling them.

loans.name: Maclean

texts.en:
Maclean is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells chips and sausages at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works six days a week.  

Maclean has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bag of lrish potatoes,  packets of sausages, a jerrycan of cooking oil, and serving utensils. Her major business challenge is thieves; also, at times the sausages supplied are of poor quality and seasonality is a problem. Her goals and aspiration are to own a fully established restaurant and to educate her children up to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bag of Irish potatoes, packets of sausages, a jerrycan of cooking oil, and serving utensils

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Mr. Batbold is 28 years old and lives with a wife and two sons in Ger, Govi-altai Province. He has been working in firewood and coal sales with his wife since September 2010. One of his sons is a student, and another is in kindergarten. Mr. Batbold decided to rent his own place to sell coal and firewood. He and his wife have plenty of experience in that area. He is requesting 1,000,000₮ to buy cheaper firewood in bulk from Zavhan province and sell it in the local market at a higher price. He said, "We are a young family. We want to operate our own business and buy a truck. If we have a truck, sales would increase and profit would be maximized." He is a hardworking and enthusiastic person.

loans.use: To buy cheaper firewood in bulk from Zavhan province and sell it in the local market at a higher price.

loans.name: Maa Narayani Self Help Group

texts.en:
Surjymani is 37 years old, living with her husband and four children who are studying in school. She is engaged in the activity of selling dried and fresh fish in the market which is two kilometres away from her village. Her husband catches fish from the Chilika lake which is near their village (Chilika is a famous lake in Odisha known for its migratory birds). The demand for fish in the region is very high as it is consumed by most of the people. 

Surjymani makes dried fish by keeping the fish in sunlight until all water in them gets evaporated which preserves them for future use (like when fish are not available in the market, in the rainy season). Dried fish is also used as a supplement to fresh fish. 

Surjymani is requesting a loan to buy a cool storing box for keeping fish, a fishing net and other insecticides to prevent fish from decaying for her fishery business. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand.

This group is made up of neighbours and friends who formed the group Narayani Self Help Group (SHG). The members of the group have selected Surjymani as their president. The lady standing in the middle wearing blue in the photo is Surjymani. The common goal of the group is to expand their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a storage box to keep fish and a fishing net.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 51 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Myrna works in the fish industry, and her husband catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase a fishing boat.  Myrna has been a member of PMPC for six years.

 In the future, Myrna hopes to own a fish carrier.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This is Hussein, a 32-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children. They are still attending school.  He had many years of experience as a barber when he decided to open his own shop in the year 2009. He intended to open the shop in his town since he knows its entire population and because most of them are really close to him. 

Hussein always seeks to please his clients and respond to their needs. And today, Hussein is asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new barbering tools for his shop in addition to some related products such as gel, shampoo, etc. He notes that this Kiva loan will improve his work, therefore allow him attract added customers and thus increase his revenues by 20%.  

Hussein has many ideas in mind, and he’s not ready to advance to a new step in his life until he’s financially satisfied. This is why he’s trying his best to develop his work and enlarge his business as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy new barbering tools for his shop in addition to some related products such as gel, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, her old parents. 

Sarah operates a beauty salon at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years and works six days a week. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy braids, hair treatments, weaves, and hair sprays. Her major business challenges are defaulters and seasonality.
