Sarah's goals and aspirations are to buy unique hair products and to own a bridal salon that will bring more customers to her salon. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more braids, hair treatments, weaves, and hair sprays.

loans.name: Felix Rafael

texts.es:
Felix es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Felix se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar videojuegos y en algunas ocasiones invita a su familia a comer un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Felix tiene un pequeño negocio de filmaciones y diseño grafico, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes.
Felix se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de equipos nuevos para su negocio, tales como ecualizadores, luces, etc.; de esta manera Feliz tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con equipos actualizados, así él espera poder a mayor cantidad de clientes e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder ampliar su negocio y así en un futuro no muy lejano desea lograr su sueño de tener su propia marca de programas de computadoras.
texts.en:
Felix, 21, is a single man living in Chincha with his parents and siblings.  He is a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Thanks to his efforts and his parents’ support, Felix is studying computer programing.  In his free time he enjoys playing video games and sometimes invites his family to eat a delicious charcoal grilled chicken.

In his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Felix has a small film and graphic design business.  He starts work every day very early in the morning.  He works about 8 hours and believes he does well because of the kind, good customer service he provides.

Felix is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy new equipment like equalizers, lights, etc. for his business so that his business will be better stocked with up-to-date equipment.  He hopes thus to be able to take care of more customers and increase his income that will be useful for him to expand the business and in the not too distant future reach his goal of having his own brand of computer software.

loans.use: to buy new equipment: equalizers, lights, etc.

loans.name: Mayra Yesenia

texts.es: Mayra tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el sector de San Manuel, Cortes junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella es muy trabajadora. Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila pero al quedar sin empleo decidió emprender su propio negocio. Hace dos años que vende variedad de mercadería como ropa, manualidades, bisutería (aretes, pulseras, anillos y collares. y ahora quiere también vender carne de pollo en su casa. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras actualmente para surtir de mercadería, va comprar un fardo de ropa de segunda para aprovechar la temporada buena y poder llevar mercaderia a la feria de la colonia y también va invertir en carne de pollo para vender, ya que es un producto de mucha demanda. Su meta es trabajar mucho para mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Mayra, 37, lives in the San Manuel sector, Cortes with her husband and three children.  She’s very hardworking.  She used to work in an assembly plant but when she became unemployed she decided to start her own business.  She’s been selling a variety of merchandise like clothes, crafts, costume jewelry (earrings, bracelets, rings and necklaces) and now she also wants to start to sell chicken meat at home.

She has requested a 10,000 Lempira loan to stock up on merchandise.  She’s going to buy a bale of used clothes to take advantage of the good season and take merchandise to the neighborhood street market and will also buy chicken meat to resell since it’s a product in high demand.  Her goal is to work hard to improve sales and income to help pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Elba Maria

texts.es:
ELBA MARIA tiene 59 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo y el conyugue en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

ELBA MARIA  se dedica a la siembra de maíz en terrenos propios y una parte arrendados, el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, fungicidas, ranger, líquido mata maleza para evitar las enfermedades.  Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El crédito le ha apoyado para seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura. El sueño es contar con una buena salud para seguir trabajando en la agricultura. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Elba María, 59, is in a civil union and has a son.  She lives with her son and spouse in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “24 de Septiembre” communal bank located in Recinto San Gabriel that belongs to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Elba María grows corn on land of her own and on leased land.  She will use the money from the loan to buy seeds, fungicide, Ranger [herbicide] and liquid weed killer to avoid illnesses.  She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

The loan has helped her to continue investing in agriculture.  Her dream is to stay healthy to continue working in agriculture.  In her free time she likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fungicide, Ranger and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married with 4 children. Elisa is 39 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement,Tudela.

Elisa is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. Elisa has requested a loan to purchase additional inorganic and commercial fertilizers. 

Elisa has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to save more for daily consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional inorganic and commercial fertilizer.

loans.name: Leidy Jackeline

texts.es:
LEIDY JACKELINE tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil unión libre no tiene hijos,vive con con el esposo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

LEIDY JACKELINE Se dedica a labores agrícolas, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas,urea,insecticidas,ranger,abono organico, 1 cerdo.
 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y un cerdo. El sueño es tener una casa y una cuadra de terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas cómo el ratón y el cogollero.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y boly.
texts.en:
Leidy Jackeline, 20, is in a civil union and has no children yet.  She lives with her husband in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “24 de Septiembre” communal bank located in Recinto San Gabriel that belongs to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Leidy Jackeline works in agriculture and also raises chickens and pigs.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, Ranger [herbicide], organic manure and one pig.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy fertilizer and a pig.  

Her dream is to own a house and a cuadra [unit of land measurement] of land.  The challenge she faces is plant diseases.  In her free time she enjoys playing Indor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, Ranger, organic manure and a pig.

loans.name: Love One Another Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Sithembile from Mutare. She is married with six children, one attending school.  

Sithembile runs a retail business selling clothes, blankets and cosmetics. The business has been in operation for 15 years. She says the main challenges faced are customer payments are taking so long, as she sells on credit. 

Sithembile has requested a loan of $400 to purchase more stock of clothes and blankets. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Sithembile plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes and blankets.

loans.name: Levita

texts.en:
Levita is 52 years old and lives in Zamora, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with four children. 

Levita has a store that sells a variety of products:  softdrinks, cooking oil, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional inventory for sale.

Levita has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Levita hopes to own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for sale.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 35 years old and single, living with his parents and three siblings. Despite his age, Mazen is obliged to work continually as he is responsible for covering the family expenses. His youngest sibling is also working in addition to the others, in order to supplement the family's income. 

As for Mazen, he owns a restaurant where he provides his customers with delicious food, especially the “Lebanese Mezza," one of the Lebanese traditions and foods that have been passed down from generation to generation. 

Regardless of being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation.  That’s why he’s asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by buying additional food provisions, such as meat, chicken, and hummus.  In the near future, Mazen requires hiring new employees to help him achieve the work tasks.

loans.use: to improve his business by buying additional food, such as meat, chicken, and hummus.

loans.name: Hijos Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Hijos del Sol” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, comida rápida, venta de útiles escolares, venta de aliños para las comidas, artesanía, mueblería, venta de ropa de bebe, servicio técnico, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Maribel, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco de color negro, en el cuello lleva puesto un pañuelo, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado, la acompañan dos de sus cuatros hijos.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la fotografía infantil desde hace 1 año. Comenta que habilito una pieza para ambientar a  un estudio fotográfico dentro de su hogar para atender a su clientela, trabaja con colegios, jardines infantiles, en eventos y fiestas. 
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en locales donde encuentra la tinta más barata y distribuidoras de papeles a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un telón (El telón de fondo de un retrato establece la configuración y el estado de ánimo para sus fotografías).
Una de las metas de Maribel es tener un local donde pueda tener su estudio fotográfico con todas sus implementaciones que necesita, así generar mayores ingresos y mas clientela, y optar por una mejor calidad de vida.
Maribel vive junto a su marido, una sobrina, su madre y cuatro hijos de 19, 14, 3 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener su casa propia y a nivel laboral tener su estudio fotográfico para generar  mayores ingresos y poder pagar los estudios de su hija ya que se encuentra en la universidad.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Hijos del Sol” (Children of the Sun) and it has 16 members who are in a variety of lines of work among which are clothing sales, fast-food sales, school supplies sales, food sauces, crafts, furniture, baby clothes, technical services and services, among others.  All are from Independencia Commune located in the city of Santiago.

Maribel is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she is seated in the front row first from right to left, wearing a black vest and a scarf around her neck; her hair is dark brown and gathered up.  Two of her four children are with her.

Her line of work for the last year has been children's photography.  She comments that she arranged a room to set it up as a photography studio in her home to take care of customers.  She works with schools, Kindergartens and at events and parties.

She buys the merchandise and supplies as needed in stores where she gets the lowest prices for ink and in low-price paper suppliers which is advantageous economically.

She will use the loan to buy a backdrop. (The backdrop curtain in a photo establishes the configuration and mood for her photos).

One of Maribel’s goals is to have a locale where she can set up her photography studio with all the equipment it needs to generate higher income and more customers and be able to opt for a better quality of life.

Maribel lives with her husband, a niece, her mother and four children who are 19, 14, 3, and 2 years of age.  Her dream for her family is to own a house and for her business is to have a photography studio to generate higher income and be able to pay for her daughter’s education; she’s attending university.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because it will make it possible for her to invest in her business.  With respect to the communal bank she’s part of she comments that very good communication exists among them.  On the other hand, the training has been useful to learn new sales and bookkeeping strategies.

Independencia is one of the 34 communes that make up the city of Santiago (Capital of Chile) and is located in the north-central sector.  It arose at the end of the 19th century as a traditional sector of the city.  It’s main axis is Independencia Avenue which used to be the ancient Road of the Inca and northern gate to the city of Santiago.  Because of its ample indigenous population, the Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile is found in Independencia.  It also has important historical buildings among which are six Chilean historical monuments.

loans.use: to buy a backdrop screen.

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es: Don Carlos, tiene 59 años de edad, es casado tiene 4 hijos y vive en el sector Cofradia, municipio de San Pedro Sula. Don Carlos trabajo un tiempo en una empresa gubernamental pero los ingresos eran muy pocos y mejor decidió dedicarse a su taller de ebanistería. Ya tiene muchos años de dedicarse a realizar esta actividad y cuenta con mucha experiencia. El fabrica todo tipo de muebles de madera como ser: mesas, sillas, muebles de sala, chineros, roperos, gaveteros, puertas y otros. Tiene su buena clientela en la comunidad donde vive. El está solicitando otro préstamo el cual es el segundo ciclo con ODEF y es por la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras, este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de madera, color, barniz, lija, pegamento y otros materiales para la fabricación de muebles. Su meta es mantener su taller abastecido de madera e insumos que necesita para trabajar bien y así poder crecer económicamente para mejorar su  calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Carlos, 59, is married and has four children; he lives in the Cofradía sector of the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  Carlos worked for a government office for a time but his income was low so he decided it would be best to go into cabinet-making.  He’s been doing this for many years and has much experience.  He manufactures all types of wood furniture like tables, chairs, living room furniture, china cabinets, armoires, file cabinets, doors and others.  He has a good clientele in his community.  

He’s asking for another loan which will be his second ODEF cycle.  It’s for 21,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy wood, stain, varnish, sandpaper, glue and other supplies needed to manufacture furniture.  His goal is to have his shop well-stocked with wood and supplies needed to work well and be able to grow economically to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy furniture-making supplies.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
MARIA EUGENIA tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil unión lire tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

MARIA EUGENIA  Se dedica a labores agrícolas a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono organico. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra y mejoraría el nivel económico de la familia.

El sueño es trabajar más y obtener mejores ingresos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es crecer las siembras.

En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
María Eugenia, 34, is in a free civil union and has two children; she lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “24 de Septiembre” communal bank located in Recinto San Gabriel belonging to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

María Eugenia works in agriculture growing corn and rice and also raises chickens and pigs.  She’s requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, Ranger [herbicide] and organic manure.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy fertilizer needed for the crops and will improve her family’s economic level.

Her dream is to work more and earn higher income.  The challenge she faces is to increase her crops.  She enjoys listening to music in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, Ranger and organic manure.

loans.name: Marlyn Mariuxi

texts.es:
MARLYN MARIUXI tiene 23 años de edad es madre soltera tiene una nena, vive con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

MARLYN MARIUXI Se dedica a labores agrícolas, además se dedica a la venta de tarjetas, recargas, cabinas telefónicas.
 
Solicita el crédito para comprar  tarjetas, recargas,urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono organico. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en la comprar de tarjetas telefónicas  y en la agricultura.
 El sueño es llegar hacer una buena comerciante. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es completar las ganancias..
En el tiempo libre le gusta ser emprtendedora "ella busca otras fuentes que le ingresen utilidades".
ronducir el auto del hermano.
texts.en:
Marlyn Mariuxi, 23, is a single mother of a little girl.  She lives with her daughter in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “24 de Septiembre” communal bank located in Recinto San Gabriel belonging to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Marlyn Mariuxi works in agriculture and also sells cards, recharges and has phone booths.  She’s requesting the loan to buy cards, recharges, urea, insecticide, Ranger [herbicide] and organic manure.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy phone cards and invest in her crops.  

Her dream is to become a good merchant.  The challenge she faces is to earn enough profits.  She enjoys being an entrepreneur in her free time; she’s always looking for other ways to generate income.  She enjoys driving her brother’s car.

loans.use: to buy cards, recharges, urea, insecticide, Ranger and organic manure.

loans.name: Tarquino Severo

texts.es:
TARQUINO SEVERO tiene 31 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provivncia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

TARQUINO SEVERO Se dedica a labores agrícolas, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono organico, semillas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra y mejoraría el stilo de vida de la familia.El sueño es comprarse 3 cuadras de terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor, boly.
texts.en:
Tarquino Severo is 31 years old, is in a civil union and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He is a member of the VRC 24 de septiembre which is located in the Recinto San Gabriel of the Ventanas canton. They make a living in agriculture and livestock. 

Tarquino Severo makes a living in agriculture and also raises chickens and pigs. He is requesting this loan to buy urea, insecticides, round up, organic fertilizers and seeds. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the fertilizers necessary to plant and improve his family's lifestyle. His dream is to buy about 4 1/2 acres of land. The challenges that he faces are the plagues. 

In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, round up, organic fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Los Perseverantes” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; almacén, venta de ropa por catalogo, venta de colaciones, venta de toallas, venta de ropa interior, feriantes, articulos para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Quilicura, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Carmen, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera de color café con flores de colores, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro, lo usa largo y suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de desayunos desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja en un triciclo ofreciendo sus desayunos a su clientela, hace queques, kuchen, pan amasado, sopaipillas, sándwich, té y café´, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6ºº de la mañana hasta las 22ºº horas.
La mercadería que va necesitando los compra en supermercados, y locales donde encuentra la mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará harina, azúcar, frutas secas, aceite, masas para las sopaipillas.
Una de las metas de Carmen son tener un local establecido y crecer para llegar hacer una microempresaria, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Carmen vive junto a su marido quien la ayuda con las ventas de los desayunos y sus dos hijos de 13 años de edad (él es discapacitado) y su hija pequeña de 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son tener un local para atender a toda su clientela, y a nivel familiar darle lo mejor a sus hijos para que su hijo siga en las capacitaciones de la teletón y su hija pequeña pueda asistir al colegio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de  la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Cometa que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo el Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Quilicura es una comuna perteneciente a Santiago, capital de Chile, ubicada en el extremo noroeste de región metropolitana. El origen del nombre de la comuna viene del mapudungun (lengua mapuche): "kila", que significa “tres” y "kura" que significa “piedra”, por lo que se deduce que el nombre de Quilicura equivale a "tres piedras", como  el nombre que le dieron los primeros habitantes de este valle en referencia a los tres cerros que son perfectamente visibles y que delimitan la comuna
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Los Perseverantes” (The Persevering Ones) and it has 15 members who are in a variety of lines of work among which are grocery store, catalogue clothing sales, snack sales, towel sales, underwear sales, street merchants, home items sales and services, among others.  All are from the Quilicura commune located in the city of Santiago.

Carmen is a communal bank member.   In the photo she’s standing in the front row, fourth from left to right, wearing a brown shirt printed with colored flowers; her hair is dark brown and it’s long and worn loose.

She has been selling breakfasts for three years.  She comments that she works with a three-wheeled cart selling breakfast to her clientele.  She makes cakes, Bundt cakes, kneaded bread, sopaipillas, sandwiches, tea and coffee.  She works Monday through Friday from 6am until 10pm.  She buys supplies as needed in supermarkets and stores where she finds it at low cost which is convenient economically.  She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, dried fruit, oil and sopaipilla dough.  One of Carmen’s goals is to have a fixed locale and to grow into a micro businesswoman to generate higher income and have the possibility of better quality of life.

Carmen lives with her husband who helps her sell the breakfasts and with her two children, a disabled 13-year-old son and a 2-year-old daughter.  Her dream at a work level is to have a locale where she can take care of all her customers and at the family level to give her children the best so that her son can continue with his Telethon [charitable rehab centers] training and her daughter can attend school.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has provided because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She comments that the training has been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development because she’s learned how to organize and better distribute her income and investments.  She comments that there is very good communication in the communal bank she belongs to.

Quilicura es a commune in the Santiago, Capital of Chile, located in the extreme northeast of the metropolitan region.  The name comes from Mapudungun (Mapuche tongue): “Kila” which means “three” and “Kura” which means “stone” from which one can deduce that the Quilicura’s name means “Three Stones” which was the name the original inhabitants of this valley gave it in reference to the three hills that are perfectly visible and define the commune.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dried fruit, oil and dough.

loans.name: Taban George

texts.en:
Taban is a 28-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 9.  Two of them go to school. Taban runs an office supply store and has been in business for 4 years. He has no employees.

Taban heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 4500 SDG to purchase computers, counter books and many other items.  Taban has no other source of income beyond this business.

In 5 years, Taban would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices. Taban says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more items likes computers, counterbooks , novels etc.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 38 years old. She lives in a small village of Gardabani District with her 15-year-old son, who goes to the local school.

Mzia is busy with agricultural business. She has a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows and 6 calves. She produces cheese products and sells locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 250 Lari. Mzia works hard to put away some savings and ensure a better future for her son.

Mzia requested a loan to purchase hay to feed the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now, but the price increases by 30% to 40% in the winter months. By buying now, Mzia can save significantly on the costs of feeding the cows. Because the cows will be fed properly in winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family, and the family's income will increase accordingly. Thus, Mzia will be able to increase her agricultural business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hay to feed her cattle while it's cheap.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
This is Nada, a 24-year-old married woman and resident of Lebanon. With an adorable family of one child and a husband, she decided to carry on her life despite all circumstances. At this time, she’s cooperating with her husband, expecting a better and shiny future for her child. 

Because of her house’s strategic spot, Nada decided to start her own business as a tailor. She works with high professionalism that makes her attract added clients. Her husband is an employee at a local company. She also works in parallel at a nursery. 

And as she wants to better develop her business and improve her work as well, she decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a modern tailoring machine that can speed up her work and make it much easier. This Kiva loan will also allow her to offer a greater quality of products and thus improve her income by a minimum of 20 percent. This is how she works every day to make her greatest dream a reality and have a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase a modern tailoring machine that can speed up her work and make it much easier.

loans.name: Villa Las Alamedas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Villa las Alamedas” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de comida rápida, venta de joyas, venta de ropa interior por catalogo, venta de pan amasado, articulos de computación, productos de protección laboral, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Mercedes, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una blusa de color café, usa anteojos, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño claro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la confección, desde hace 13 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa, ya que adapto una parte para hacer un taller, realiza arreglos como cambio de cierres, bastas, y confecciona vestidos, buzos y lo que su clientela le solicite, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en locales que se especializan en vender telas y accesorios para las confecciones a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará telas, hilos para la maquina bordadora y remalladora, botones, cierres, agujas.
Una de las metas de Mercedes son tener la posibilidad de comprar una máquina colleretera (es una maquina que puede utilizar 1 a 3 agujas), y cambiar su máquina overlock por una mas nueva, para generar más trabajo y cumplir con las expectativas de su clientela, así generar mayores ingresos y dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Mercedes vive junto a su marido y su hija de 19 años quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel personal es tener salud para seguir trabajando en su rubro y ver a su hija que termine de estudiar y se titule, para ver su tarea cumplida.
Mercedes está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe respeto y unidad.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank es called “Villa las Almendras” and it has 15 members who are in a variety of lines of work among which are fast-food sales, jewelry sales, sale of underwear by catalogue, baked bread sales, computer supplies, work safety products and services, among others.  All are from the San Bernardo commune located in the city of Santiago.

Mercedes is a communal bank member.   In the photo she’s seated in the front row, first from right to left, wearing a brown blouse.  She’s wearing eyeglasses and her hair is dark brown and work loose.

She has been sewing for 13 years.  She comments that she works at home since she set aside part of it for her workshop.  She does repairs like zipper replacement and basting and she makes dresses, sweatshirts and whatever else her customers request.  Her work schedule varies according to her availability.  She buys the supplies and merchandise she needs in stores that specialize in low-cost fabrics and sewing accessories which is economically advantageous.  She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread for the embroidery machine and for the overlock machine, buttons, zippers and needles.

One of Mercedes’ goals is to be able to buy a special sewing machine (one that can use from one to three needles) and to replace her overlock machine with a newer one to generate more work and meet customer expectations thus generating higher income and providing better quality of life for her family.

Mercedes lives with her husband and 19-year-old daughter who is studying.  Her dream on a personal level is to continue working in her occupation and to see her daughter complete her studies and graduates so her work will be complete.

Mercedes is very happy and grateful for the loan and services provided by Fondo Esperanza.  She also comments that she feels very comfortable in the meetings and with her communal bank group because respect and unity are present.

San Bernardo es a city located 18 kilometers straight south from the main square in Santiago (Capital of Chile).   It’s known as the capital of folklore because every year in January the “International Folklore Festival” takes place there, an event where the country’s roots and musical groups from all over South America meet.  Also, Chilean craftspeople as well as others from nearby countries participate too.  Then in April, the “Abril Cuecas Mil” event takes place.  It consists in making the entire commune dance ‘cueca’ (a traditional Chilean dance).

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and needles.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 47-year-old Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and four children. Two children are working and the others are still attending school. He is a brave and, above all, hard-working man.  A few years ago, Ahmad rented a plot of land in his town. He performed the needed changes on it to turn it into a parking lot and benefit from monthly rental charges providing his family with extra financial support. 

With his requested loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l., he will purchase a gate to better protect the land and the cars that are parked there, especially at night. In that way, he will be able to gain his clients' trust, therefore attracting more customers and increasing his revenues. He is hoping to expand his business soon by increasing his work and collecting higher revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a gate to better protect the land and the cars that are parked there, especially at night

loans.name: Jessielyn

texts.en:
Jessielyn is 37 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with three children. 

Jessielyn deals in ready-to-wear clothing and earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional clothing for sale. 

Jessielyn has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Jessielyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional ready-to-wear clothing for sale.

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 29 años de edad, vive en Sololá junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de ellos un varón y una mujer ambos menores de edad.
El es un hombre agricultor que trabaja fuerte para mantener a su familia. Cultiva verduras como zanahoria, papa, remolacha, repollo y habas en una parcela que alquila a pocos kilómetros de su vivienda.
Este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres hace muchos años la cual fue el primer trabajo de su vida, esto es por que no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir   a una escuela.
El ahora tiene 15 años de ser independiente realizando este trabajo pero con un capital en efectivo propio. Esto no le ha dado oportunidad de expandir su cultivo, de este modo  ve su necesidad y se decidió por primera vez solicitar un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y abono orgánico ya que por la temporada del año  la cosecha es mejor. Esto ara que cultive mas en otras parcelas expandiendo su verdura.
Cultivar variedad de verduras es su mayor sueño ya que existen otras que mejoran los precios a comparación de las que cultiva actualmente, así mismo poder darles mejores estudios académicos a sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a 29 year old man who lives in Sololá together with his wife and his two children, one a boy and one a girl, and both still minors.  He works in agriculture and works hard to maintain his family.  He plants vegetables like carrots, potatoes, beets, cabbage and beans on a parcel that he rents a few kilometers from his home.  He learned this work from his parents many years ago, and it was his first job in life.  That's why he did not have the opportunity to attend school.  

He has now been working independently in this field for 15 years, but with his own capital.  This has not given him the opportunity to expand his crops, and thus he sees the need and decided for the first time to ask for a loan of 4,000 Quetzales (Guatemalan currency) in order to purchase potato seeds and organic fertilizers.  During this season the harvest is better.  With these funds he can cultivate more in other parcels and expand his crop.  His greatest dream is to cultivate a variety of vegetables since others exist that offer better prices in comparison to what he currently produces.  He also wants to be able to provide his children with better academic studies in the future.

loans.use: To purchase potato seed and organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is married, with three children.  She is 43 years old and lives in Dolipos Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Librada is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase dried fish for sale.

Librada has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Librada hopes to own enough savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with five children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells fish at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations are to start going to landing sites for fish and  to educate her children up to the university level. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 44 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is single. 

Rosalinda has a store that sells a variety of products:  soft drinks, cooking oil, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional inventory for sale.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Rosalinda hopes to own a house and a lot someday.

loans.use: To  buy additional inventory for sale.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Mrs. Batchuluun is 43 years old and she lives with her husband in a ger in Uvs province. Her husband is a woodsman. Her son moved out from his parents' home. 

Mrs.Batchuluun was a cook at a local cafe and customers loved her meals. She has decided to cater for local company employees for lunch and other meals. She already had talked with several managers and contracted with some of them. She will be starting to cook various kinds of Mongolian traditional dishes at home to sell to employees for lunch and deliver to companies. She won't be needing a workplace. She is well-experienced and popular with local customers. She is asking for 1,000,000 MNT to buy meat and other raw materials when the price of meat has fallen to the cheapest point in the year. She is a hard-working and diligent woman.

loans.use: To buy meat and other raw materials when the price of meat has fallen to its cheapest point in the year

loans.name: Karla Lesly

texts.es:
Karla es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Karla trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella cuenta con una pequeño espacio en su casa donde vende sus productos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Karla se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como cremas, maquillaje, perfumes, talcos, entre otros productos de belleza; de esta manera Karla tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder ampliar su negocio y en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder lograr su sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Karla is a young woman who's 20 years old. She lives in the town of Chiclayo with her little son, whom she loves and is her main reason to live. She's a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person with a great deal of drive to succeed. She unfortunately lacked financial resources and needed to work in order to support her parents and pay for her expenses, but she would have very much liked to have studied for a career in accounting. In her spare time, she enjoys watching educational programs on television. Occasionaly, she cooks delicious noodles that she shares with her family.
With a lot of hard work and dedication, and thanks to her mother's support, Karla runs her small business selling beauty products. She has a small space in her home where she sells her products. Every day she starts working from the early hours of the morning. She may work up to 12 hours on average, and she believes that she does well because of her kindness towards her customers.
Karla is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she'll be able to purchase merchandise such as lotions, makeup, perfumes, powder, etc. That way Karla will better stock up her business, and thus she hopes to be able to increase her sales and her proceeds. This would very much help her to expand her business. Within a not-so-distant future, she wishes to achieve her dream of owning a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as lotions, makeup, perfumes, powder, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools including a polishing machine, ceramic cutter, and a wooden trowel used to smooth plaster, etc.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a married man living with his wife and two children, who attend school. He’s a 45-year-old hard worker looking to support his family and satisfy their needs. Khalil has many years of experience in his recent job. He’s a furniture painter who works with high professionalism. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can. He’s known for being punctual and well organized. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his painting tools. He will be utilizing the loan to facilitate and carry on his work in a proper way. He is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he looks to take more projects maybe outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to renew his painting tools

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion is married with three children. Asuncion is 56 years old and lives in Clarin Settlement, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a farmer and grows  coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 49,000 PHP to pay for the placement fee  for her daughter to go abroad. Asuncion has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to pay for the placement fee for her daughter to go abroad

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 22, and married with one child. He is the only provider for the family. Wissam owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010. Now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to buy a refrigerator and pay the annual rent. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and pay the annual rate

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married, living with his wife and one child.  Ali is the one responsible for covering his child’s demands and above all enhancing the family’s way of living. 

He has been working installing curtains for outside and inside houses. He woks independently, and he has great experience and a fair number of clients as well. He also visits his clients at their places.  

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new textile designs, buttons, needles, and many other items. In that way, he will be able to take on more projects and therefore increase his earnings. 

He’s an ambitious man who always seeks to improve his family’s life by better developing his work.

loans.use: to buy new textile designs, buttons, needles, and many other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras son todas las miembros de este grupo, es por ello que el comité lleva ese nombre. Son 17 mujeres muy emprendedoras que desean salir adelante y saben que por medio del trabajo pueden hacerlo.
Elena es miembro de este grupo, y también es la presidenta, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos en su pequeño Kiosko, cuenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que siempre tiene un buen trato y precio para sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, golosinas, comestibles, y demás, con lo que podrá surtirse y tener mayor variedad que dar a sus clientes.
texts.en: Mujeres Emprendedoras consists of the members of this group, which is why the committee holds the same name. They are 17 very entrepreneurial women that wish to get ahead, and they know that through hard work they can achieve this. Elena is one of the members of this group, and she is also the president. She focuses on selling all types of products from her small kiosk, and she has reported strong sales thanks to her caring treatment of her clients and her good prices. She is seeking a loan to purchase drinks, snacks, edibles, and other goods to supply herself and have a bigger variety of goods to offer her clients.

loans.use: To buy drinks, snacks, edibles, and other goods.

loans.name: Las Semillitas Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Peru! La Sr. Raul es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Las Semillitas”, un grupo conformado por 7 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Raúl trabaja desde hace 10 años en un negocio de planchado y pintura para vehiculos junto con un amigo que es su socio, este negocio surge a raiz de que raul se quedo sin trabajo la situacion era preocupante ya que tenia que mantener a su menor hijo es asi que junto a su amigo forman su negocio con mucho entusiasmo. 

Raul ha solicitado el préstamo para comprar mercaderia (pintura y todos los instrumentos que se necesitan para planchar un vehiculo)  , para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

Raul es separado y tiene 1 hijo. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, Raul ha logrado mejores ingresos, su hijo estudia en la universidad y cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida. Raul está muy contento con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Greeting from Peru! Sr. Raúl is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Semillitas” (The Seedlings), a group that consists of seven members who engage in various business activities.

Raúl has worked 10 years doing vehicle painting and body repairs with his friend who is also his business partner. This business emerged after Raúl lost his job. The situation worried him because he has a son to support. As a result, he and his friend established this business together with great enthusiasm.

Raúl is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies (paint and all the equipment he needs to do vehicle body repairs) so that he can provide better service to his customers. He is separated from his spouse and has one child. Thanks to his effort and dedication, Raúl has been able to improve his income. His son is studying at the university and now has a better quality of life. Raúl is very pleased with this loan and expresses his appreciation to EDAPROSPO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy automobile paint and equipment used in performing auto body repairs.

loans.name: Veronica Rosario

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; Verónica no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de Turismo y Hotelería, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su Padre, Verónica puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y adicionalmente bebidas, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas, donde puede atender a un promedio de 40 clientes, ella cree que le va bien porque es muy conocida por sus clientes.
Verónica se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tanto prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, así como bebidas, gaseosas, agua mineral, refresco, cerveza y otros; de esta manera Verónica tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder ampliar su negocio y lograr su sueño de terminar de construir la casa de su Padre, donde viven juntos.
texts.en:
Verónica is a 50 year old woman and lives in the city of Chincha with her two children who she loves and who are the principle motivation for her life.  She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person.  She puts forth all of her effort to help her family get ahead, since she has always been father and mother to her children.  Veronica could not pursue a professional career, but she would have very much liked to study Hotel Management and Tourism.  In her free time she likes to listen to music and sometimes she cooks a delicious Carapulcra (Pork and dried potato stew) to share with her family.  

With much hard-work, dedication, and thanks to the support of her father, Veronica began a small business selling clothing and also drinks.  Everyday from early in the morning she begins her work.  She is able to work approximately 12 hours, and she waits on around 40 clients on average.  She believes that things are going well because she is very well known by her customers.  

Veronica is very grateful for the loans from Kiva, since thanks to the assistance offered she has been able to purchase merchandise including clothing for women, men and children, as well as drinks like sodas, mineral water, soft-drinks, beer and other beverages.  With this loan Veronica will be able to better supply her business.  She is hoping to increase her sales and grow her income.  This will help her greatly to expand her business and reach her dream of building a house for her father, where they can live together.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and drinks.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 53 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. Elvie is married with 4 children. 

Elvie has a store that sells variety of products. She has had this business for 8 years and has requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. for her store.

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Elvie hopes to save for her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents for her store.

loans.name: Merlyn's Group

texts.en:
Merlyn is 31 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

Merlyn is engaged in a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP2,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing feed for her hog fattening business. 

Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 7 years. In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand her business. Merlyn is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hog-fattening business

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras lleva el nombre de Kuña Katupyry, tiene 12 miembros, están en el primer ciclo, y están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La señora  María, actualmente ella vive sola , ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, en lo que trabaja vendiendo casa por casa, por las calles de la ciudad de Carapeguá hace más de 30 años, todos los días sin importar el clima. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido dar todo lo que puede a sus hijos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras de todo tipo, para poder seguir dando una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: This group of female entrepreneurs calls itself Kuña Katupyry. It has 12 members, and they are in their first year, learning to work together and help each other. Señora María, who currently lives by herself, has devoted herself to selling vegetables every day, going house to house, among the streets in the city of Carapeguá for more than thirty years. Thanks to this work, she has been able to offer all that she can to her children. She is seeking a loan to buy all types of vegetables, in order to continue offering a good variety for her clients.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Dinora Lizeth

texts.es: Dinora, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en un sector de Cofradia, San Pedro Sula, Cortes, junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos. Ella tiene 11 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, lácteos, carnes, harina, manteca, especies, frijoles, refrescos, churros, productos de limpieza y otros. Ella anteriormente vendía ropa y zapatos pero decidió mejor por este negocio que es más rentable. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos alimenticios para surtir el negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es terminar de construir su casa con las ganancias que le genere el negocio.
texts.en:
Dinora, age 32, lives in the Cofradia sector of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.  She lives with her life partner and their two children.

She established her own business 11 years ago.  She has a mini-market where she sells basic needs items like rice, dairy products, meat, flour, shortening, spices, beans, soft drinks, churros, cleaning products, and others.  She previously sold clothes and shoes, but she decided that this business is better because it is more profitable.

The loan she is requesting is for 10,000 lempiras.  She will use it to buy more food products to stock the business and to offer the customers better service.

Her goal is to finish building her house with the income that the business generates.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, soft drinks, sugar, shortening, beans, flour, coffee, salt, soap, condiments, and other groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is married with five children. She is 64 years old and lives in Tonggo Namut, Tudela.

Carmelita is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. Carmelita has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers, such as inorganic and commercial. 

Carmelita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to save for her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, such as inorganic and commercial

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Mujeres Alegres”,  están en el segundo ciclo con  20 integrantes y cada una de ella se esfuerza por salir adelante y dar lo mejor a sus hijos y familiares.
Vanessa es parte de este desafío que todas tomaron. Ella vente calzados de todo tipo, para damas y caballeros, y está saliendo adelante gracias al sacrificio que hace día con día. Comenta que su meta es seguir creciendo y el día de mañana poder ser una gran microempresaria.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados y así cumplir con pedidos que tiene y también poder atraer a mas clientela. Agradece el grupo por la oportunidad que reciben, pues están muy entusiasmadas de seguir.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Alegres" has 20 members and is in its second loan cycle.  Each of these members works hard to get ahead and give the best to their children and families.

Vanessa is one of the members of this group, all of whom have taken up the challenge to get ahead.  She sells all types of shoes for men and women, and is getting ahead thanks to the sacrifice she makes each day.  She comments that her goal is to continue to grow so that in the future she can become a great businesswoman.  

She is requesting a loan to buy shoes so that she can fill the orders that she has, and also attract more customers.  

This group appreciates the opportunity that they are receiving, and they are enthusiastic about continuing with their businesses.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 26, who is married and has one child. Two family members live with him and he is the only provider for the family.

Amjad is a blacksmith. He established his business in 2009 after having good experience in this field. He now has three employees and a good reputation within his local community.

He is requesting $2,400 as a loan to buy a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Enna Ernestina

texts.es:
ENNA ERNESTINA tiene 53 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

ENNA ERNESTINA  se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios y una parte arrendados, el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, fungicidas, ranger, líquido mata maleza, urea para evitar las enfermedades.  Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El crédito le ha ayudado para comprar los fertilizantes. El sueño es emprender un nuevo negocios de venta de ropa. En los tiempos libres le gusta cocinar, cantar.
texts.en:
Enna Ernestina is 53 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Enna Ernestina is a member of the September 24th Communal Bank, which is located in the San Gabriel neighborhood in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farming and livestock breeding.

Enna Ernestina grows corn and rice on land that she owns and on some that she rents. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds, fungicides, Ranger (a brand of herbicide), liquid weed killer, and urea so that she can prevent crop diseases. Her purchases are conducted in the city of Ventanas. This loan will help her to buy fertilizers. Her dream is to start a new business of selling clothes.

In her free time, Enna Ernestina enjoys cooking and singing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fungicides, herbicide, liquid weed killer, and urea.

loans.name: Owadis

texts.en:
Owadis is a 23-year-old single man who lives with his parents and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He works at his house where he produces jewelry to sell to local markets. 

In order to get additional revenue and be able to pay the heavy life expenses with ease, he started a new job in 2009 at a local company where he works during his free time. 

Today, he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, with which he will purchase materials and products needed to facilitate his work and make his operations easier to perform. 

Owedis is a hard worker. He has high hopes for the future of his business and is eager to start soon.

loans.use: to will purchase materials and products needed for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing items like t-shirts, blouses, pants, etc.

loans.name: Kileba Tombek

texts.en:
Kileba is a 48-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 6 children between the ages of 4 and 19. All of them go to school.

Kileba runs a general store and has been in business for 4 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 5,000 SDG to purchase sugar, rice, tea leaves, and many other items for his store. Other than this business, Kileba has no other source of income.

In 5 years' time, Kileba would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenge includes high market prices.

Kileba says he is happy for the loan given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items, like sugar, rice, and tea leaves for his general store

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a forty-year-old farmer in Nkubu county, Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children, who are in school. He has been in farming for six years, producing milk, tea, fruits, and vegetables, which he sells to middle men. He also operates a hotel as an additional source of income.

He is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter, which will help him in providing more feed for his dairy cows, hence more milk production and income, which would help improve his living standards and pay for his children's school fees.

His major challenges in farming are crop and animal pests, and diseases.

Julius says that Juhudi Kilimo offers very good services to its clients.

loans.use: to purchase a chuff cutter for his farm

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria Angelica forma parte del Banco Comunal “Pequeño Emprendedor” perteneciente a la comuna de Puente Alto, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica a la venta de almacén desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa, donde habilito un espacio dentro de su casa para atender a su clientela, trabaja de martes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras que se especializan en vender alimentos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería como harina, azúcar, te, arroz, bebidas y lácteos.
Una de las metas de Maria Angelica es crecer con su almacén y llegar a tener un minimarket, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria Angelica vive junto a su hija y su nito de 8 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener su casa propia para tener junto a su hija y nieto una buna calidad de vida.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que tienen una muy buena comunicación y comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
María Angélica is part of Pequeño Emprendedor Communal Bank in the town of Puente Alto, located in the city of Santiago.  She has made a living for three years with a general store.  She says she works at home, where she fixed up a space to serve her customers.  She works Tuesday through Sunday and arranges her schedule according to her availability.  She buys her merchandise from distribution companies that specialize in selling food at low cost, so it's financially advantageous.

With the loan she's going to buy merchandise such as flour, sugar, tea, rice, beverages, and dairy products.

One of María Angélica's goals is to grow with her store and to have a convenience store to earn more income and to have a better quality of life.

María Angélica lives with her daughter and her grandson, age 8.  Her dream for her family is to have her own house so she and her daughter and grandson can have a good quality of life.

She's very grateful for and happy about this opportunity from Fondo Esperanza because it has allowed her to invest in her business.  In addition, she's comfortable with the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank group because they communicate well and share various activities and interests, which also has served as a distraction.  With regard to the training that's given in the meetings, she has learned to better manage her business.

The Puente Alto community is located to the north of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  It was founded at the end of the nineteenth century as a small rural community, but given its demographic growth, currently it's one of the biggest municipalities in Chile, with a population of more than 600,000.  It's the gateway to one of the foothill areas of the metropolitan region known as Cajón del Maipó, an area with space for walking, horseback riding, rafting, and other activities and lodging and dining services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, tea, rice, beverages, and dairy products

loans.name: Matsatsa

texts.en:
Matsatsa is from the small village of Tetritskaro district. She is 49 years old, married, and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and mother-in-law. Her husband works as an electrician for a private company and her mother-in-law is a teacher at the local school. Both of them get monthly incomes. The main source of income for the family is their agricultural business. In particular, they have a calf, a milk cow, and three pigs. Matsatsa milks the cow and produces dairy products. The family runs a small poultry farm as well and has 50 hens. They sell dairy products, piglets, and eggs locally. Matsatsa works hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions for her family.

She requested a loan to purchase cattle. She will buy additional milk cows and be able to sell more dairy products. Matsatsa hopes her business will generate a higher income. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions, renovate the house, and purchase a car. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows so she can produce more dairy products

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Fátima se formo en la ciudad de Carapeguá, actualmente el comité se encuentra en el noveno ciclo con 20 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en progresar y trabajar para salir adelante.
 La mayoría de estas mujeres se dedica a tejer, y por medio de este trabajo obtienen los ingresos que necesitan para ir creciendo. Desean que sus hijos sean personas de bien y útiles a los demás.
Una de ellas es Silvia, y ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, bastidores y demás insumos para poder seguir tejiendo y de esta forma ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima committee was started up in the city of Carapeguá and currently is on their ninth loan cycle with twenty members.  They are hard-working women who go to a lot of trouble to progress and work to get ahead.  

Most of the women are embroiderers, and through their work they bring in the income they need to grow.  They want their children to become good people and useful to others.

Silvia is one of the members, and she's seeking a loan to buy thread, needles, frames, and all the other supplies to be able to continue embroidering so she can earn her living.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, frames, etc.

loans.name: Gulsunda

texts.en: Gulsunda is from the Kvareli district of East Georgia. She is 64 years old and lives with her husband. Both family members are provided with retirement pensions. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own a calf and a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy products. Gulsunda produces yogurt and sells it locally. Also, they have a vineyard and a plot of land, where maize is grown. The family completes all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good harvest. They produce wine and sell the agricultural products at the local open market. Gulsunda works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to build her savings and improve the living conditions of her family. She has requested a loan to renovate her house. Her existing house is old and damaged. Gulsunda will purchase building materials and repair her home. Then, the living conditions of her family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Gulsunda hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 21 years old, single, and lives with five family members, one of whom is employed.

Houssein owns a shop selling electrical supplies. He established his business in 2009. He built good experience in this field and a good reputation within his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 youth loan to pay for the annual rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 59 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has four children. Marita owns a photography shop and earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to to purchase additional capital for photo lamination and other supplies for the business.
Marita has been a member of the field partner PMPC for five years. In the future, Marita hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase additional capital for photo lamination etc.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 21, single, and lives with five family members, one of whom is employed.

Iyad owns a big generator and he provides his neighborhood with electricity. He established his business in 2011 and he now has an employee. He built good experience in this field and has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a new power head for his generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new power head for his generator

loans.name: Vicente Azisclo

texts.es:
VICENTE AZISCLO tiene 39 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

VICENTE AZISCLO  Se dedica a labores agrícolas, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, semillas, balanceado,urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono organico. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar animales y los fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra. Las compras las realizara en la ciudad de Ventanas.

 El sueño es comprarse 2 cuadras de tierras. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta compratir momentos con la familia.
texts.en:
Vicente Azisclo is 39 years old. He is single and lives with his two children in the "la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos" (the City of Windows, in the Province of the Rivers).

He is a member of the VRC 24th of September, located in the San Gabriel building in the cantón Ventanas. This bank serves those who work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Vicente Azisclo both farms and raises chickens and pigs. He is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens, seeds, animal feed, urea fertilizer, insecticides, Ranger (a weed killer), and organic fertilizer. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the animals and fertilizers necessary for the upcoming sowing season. He will make these purchases locally in the "ciudad de Ventanas".

Vicente's dream is to buy two plots of land. His biggest obstacles are plagues for the crops. When he can, Vicente likes to spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, seeds, animal feed, urea fertilizer, Ranger (a weed killer), insecticides, ranger, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida primero formò parte de un grupo de mujeres o banco mujer,pero por razones personales despuès del segundo crèdito se retirò del banco.Actualmente quiere poner en su casa una pequeña pulperìa, en la que venderà productos por catàlogo que ya està vendiendo en forma ambulante y abarrotes,considerando que en  su sector no hay un negocio que estè ofreciendo este tipo de servicio.La activida le permitirà obtener dinero para apoyar gastos de su familia, ya que su esposo es un trabajador ocasional, en actividades agrìcolas. Su limitaciòn para iniciar es el dinero, pero vio en la Fundaciòn la oportunidad de contar con un crèdito nuevamente para poder concretar su proyecto.Ella vive con su esposo, y su hijo de dos años, el tener un negocio le permite cuidar a su hijo y no salir a trabajar fuera de su casa.
texts.en:
Zaida was originally a member of a women’s group (also known as a women’s bank). However, due to personal reasons, she left the group after she completed her second loan cycle. Zaida now has a small convenience store established in her home. She sells products through a catalog as a traveling vendor, but she also sells groceries. There are no other businesses in the area that offer this type of service.

Zaida’s business enables her to generate income to help with the family expenses. Her husband is a seasonal laborer who engages in farming activities.
