From the very beginning, her main limitation has been the lack of money. Therefore, she has taken the opportunity to contact Fundación Mujer about applying for a new loan so that she can solidify her business.

Zaida lives with her husband and two-year-old son. Owning a business enables her to look after her child without having to work outside of the home.

loans.use: to remodel her store and to buy groceries and bazaar merchandise.

loans.name: Remy Herbert

texts.es:
Remy es un hombre de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposa y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida,  él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Remy trabaja como Auxiliar de Oficina en la empresa de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 87 horas diarias y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable en su trabaja y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Remy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, tales como pintado, tarrajeo y otros pequeños acabados; de esta manera Remy tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones, más adecuadas y seguras para que su familia pueda habitar en ella sin correr riesgos, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Remy is a 37 year old man, living in the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Guadalupe, with his wife and three young children, whom he loves and are the most important people to him. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, who along with his wife, devotes his efforts to support his family. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to study towards a professional career. 

Through his own drive, effort and enthusiasm, Remy works as an office assistant in a company located in his city. He starts work in the early hours of the morning every day and can work up to 87 hours a week; he believes work goes well for him given that he is very responsible in his job and treats others around him kindly. 

Remy is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, seeing as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to accomplish the improvements for his own home, such as painting and plastering the walls, as well as other details. Through these improvements, Remy's home will be in better conditions that will be more appropriate and secure so that his family can live there without taking any risks. Nevertheless, he will continuing working and striving to achieve his dream of seeing his children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to carry out improvements for his home.

loans.name: Wave Stars Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! 

This is 35-year-old Naomi from Mutare. She is married with two children who both attend school. Naomi runs an agriculture business producing poultry. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges she faces are variable market demands for poultry, as well as high competition. Naomi has requested a loan of $400 to buy more chicks (baby chickens) and feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to continue sending her children to school. In the future, Naomi plans to operate a farm where she can have more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete repairs, maintenance, and to purchase tires for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy material for making bottles.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 29 years, married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.
Najah owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. His shop is located in an industrial cluster (area). He established his business in 2008. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.
He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy two refrigerators and install a rolling shutter for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators and install a rolling shutter for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for ready-made clothes selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 23 years, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.
Fadel owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.
He is requesting $2,400 loan to renovate the window shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the window shop

loans.name: Panuel Christopher

texts.en:
Panuel is a 38 year old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 5 children between the ages of 4 and 15, all of whom go to school. He runs a general store which has been in business for 4 years. He has no employees, and no other source of income. 
	
Panuel heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. He is taking a loan of 5000 SDG to purchase airtime, sweets, and other products. In 5 years he would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenge is high market prices. He says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more products like sweets, airtime etc.

loans.name: Christopa

texts.en:
Christopa is a 37 year old business man who lives in Juba, South Sudan. He is married and has five children between the ages of three and 13.  All of them go to school. Christopa runs a hotel and has been in business for three years. He has two employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. He is taking a loan of 2000 sdg to purchase beer, pool, and many other things for the hotel. This business is his only source of income. In five years, Christopa would like to expand his business and open other branches of the hotel. His biggest challenge is the high market prices.
Christopa says that he is thankful for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like beer, soda, pool etc.

loans.name: 31-Rosas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 31-ROSAS está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones,   la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Rosalynn  tiene 60 años tiene 1 hijo ya independiente, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos de dormitorio como juego de sabanas, edredones  y almohadas, ella  entrega a distintos  puestos de venta y domicilios, ya que le hacen pedidos ella entrega sus productos a crédito, la Sra. Rosalynn vive en su domicilio que  se encuentra en la zona de la Blanco Galindo,  este préstamo es el  tercero que ha tomado con la institución, la Sra. Rosalynn va a usar este préstamo para la compra de juegos de sabana por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos, la Sra. Rosalynn enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención con la compra de variedad de productos, la Sra. Rosalynn se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “31-Rosas” consists of nine members, seven women and two men. The group president is Sra. Rosalynn. She is 60 years old and has one child who is independent. Rosalynn is a small businesswoman who offers a variety of household products such as bed sheet sets, quilts, and pillows. She delivers her products to different vending stalls and to customers’ homes. Rosalynn accepts orders and extends credit for the products she delivers.

Sra. Rosalynn lives in her home in the District of Blanco Galindo. This is the third loan she has taken with Emprender. She will use this loan to buy bed sheet sets in bulk since she already has many orders. Sra. Rosalynn faces challenges in her business, such as the demand for new products. She will utilize the benefits of this loan so that she can purchase a variety of products and offer better service. Sra. Rosalynn is pleased and expresses her appreciation to Emprender for the support it has provided by issuing this loan.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necessities such as ingredients and furniture for her son's food vending business

loans.name: Dino

texts.en:
Dino, 38, is one of TLM's clients who were funded by KIVA lenders in October 2011. Dino received a loan of IDR 3,000,000 that was spent on minivan spare parts to replace the damaged one. Dino is grateful for receiving the loan as it enabled him to repair the minivan and generate more income for his family needs besides repaying the loan back to TLM. 
Dino would like to replace the old minivan's engine with a new one in order to improve the work of the van. Therefore, he submitted his second loan application to TLM and requested IDR 3,000,000. Dino is hoping that the loan assistance would have a positive impact on his business.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan engine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animal feed for her dairy business

loans.name: Orpa

texts.en: Orpa is a 40-year-old lady who is married to Musa, a 60-year-old man. They are blessed with two children: Iskandar, 11, is attending 6th grade of elementary school; and Valentino, 5. Orpa runs a business selling cakes, and she has been engaged in the business for several years. She sells fried bananas, donuts, fried bread, and nagasari (steamed cake made of wheat flour, banana and coconut milk then wrapped in banana leaves). She wakes up early every day to prepare the cakes, then sells them from 7 to 11 am and continues in the evening until all the cakes are sold out. Orpa is so grateful for having regular customers who are mostly her neighbors. She intends to make various cakes to sell as demanded by her customers, but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she requested a loan of 5,000,000 Indonesian rupiah. This loan will be spent on buying wheat flour in bulk, eggs, margarine, cooking oil and other ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour in bulk, eggs, margarine, cooking oil and other ingredients.

loans.name: Swaranalata

texts.en:
Swaranalata is a 20-year-old unmarried girl living with her parents in the Khurda District of Odisha, India. She is engaged in the activity of making and selling handmade wall hangings, cushion covers, paper bags, candles, purses, etc. She makes these items in her home and sells them to the dealers in the nearby market. Her father is not financially strong enough to manage the family, so she helps her father manage the family expenses.

Swaranalata has requested a loan of 30,000 Indian rupees for purchasing fabrics, colours, paper, glue, glitters, decorative glass, wax, etc., in a bulk so that she can make her crafts in a large amount. She also wants to appoint one more person, who can assist her in the business and help her to make more of the products. In the future, she wants to give training to the village girls about this art. She also has a dream of giving her parents a quality standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fabrics, colours, wax, glitters, glue, and decorative glass for doing her craft work.

loans.name: Arjuna

texts.en:
Arjuna is a 32-year-old man from the Khurda District of Odisha, India. He has a fish selling business with 11 years of experience. He lives with his two brothers and their parents. His monthly income is 8,000 Indian rupees (INR).

Arjuna is requesting a loan of 40,000 INR to purchase a secondhand auto-rickshaw for transporting the fish he purchases from fishermen to the many village markets in Khurda. Combining the loan with his own savings, he hopes to be able to make this investment for his business. An auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled vehicle) is one of the most common and essential modes of transportation in India. An auto-rickshaw will help Arjuna transport his fish to more local markets quickly and easily and increase his profit.

loans.use: to pay for an auto-rickshaw for transporting fish

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is from the Telavi district of Kakheti region. He is 26 years old and lives with his wife, child and grandparents, who are pensioners. George is involved in an agricultural business and has six pigs and 14 piglets. In addition, he owns a vineyard and a plot of land where maize is grown.

George also has two trucks. He takes wood from the forest and sells it in his village and nearby villages. George requested a loan to purchase tires for his truck, because it is damaged and is already risky to drive in the forest. For this reason, George has stopped operations and takes wood only with one car. After changing the tires, George will be able to continue transportation by both of his trucks and sell more wood. The other part of this loan will be used to purchase agricultural land. George plans to lay out a vineyard and expand his agricultural business. This will increase the family income. Increased income will enable them to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tires for his truck and purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Bhagirathi

texts.en:
A young man of 21, Bhagirathi lives with his parents and is the sole provider for his family. The family lives in the rural area of Odisha, an eastern state of India.  

Bhagirathi owns a general shop in his village selling a variety of products such as betel, snacks, electric bulbs, etc. He applied for a 30,000 Indian rupee loan to diversify his products to meet the different demands of his customers. By purchasing more household products for his shop, Bhagirathi hopes to increase his profit and improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for a variety of household products for his general shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bangles for her bangle sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is from Iraq. She is a youth client. She is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Her dad is employed.

Hanan graduated from a medical institute and she became a nurse. In 2009, she opened a small clinic for health examination and medical treatments. She has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Hanan is requesting a $3000 youth loan to pay the annual rent for the clinic. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the clinic.

loans.name: Biswaranjan

texts.en:
Biswaranjan is a 26-year-old differently-able person living with his parents and wife in a small village in Odisha, India. He owns and manages a poultry farm, where he grows up the chicks and sells them in the market to dealers. He is the only person earning in the family, so all the family burden is on him. He earns 5,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from this farm, which is not sufficient for the family.

Biswaranjan has a plan to make his farm bigger and add some chicks to his farm, as the demand for chicken in the region is very high. He also has a plan to purchase medicines and chick food in bulk so that he can reduce his frequent visits to the market and minimize his transportation costs.

Biswaranjan has requested a loan of 40,000 INR for purchasing more chicks, their medicines and food. He says that doing so will improve his family's economic condition.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing more chicks, their medicines and food for his poultary farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her husband's clothes selling business.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is from Iraq. He is a youth client. He is 27 years old, married, and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Imad owns a small factory for cemetery stones. He has been in this business since 2002 and he now has two employees. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Imad is requesting a loan of $1800 to buy a machine for cutting stones. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting stones.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for her husband's animal sales business.

loans.name: Rumba

texts.en:
Rumba, who is 41 years old, lives with his wife and children in his own home. He owns a store where he sells products for daily consumption, like basic grains, bread, eggs, milk, etc. He has had this business for two years and it has given him good experience in sales, which has allowed him to increase his income. The store is located in his home and is well known in the area. He has many customers and is preferred by many because he carries high quality products, has good prices, and above all provides excellent service.

Rumba is an entrepreneur with a strong desire to get ahead. He puts all of his strength into his work because he knows it is the only way he will be successful. 

In the last few weeks the demand for items in his store has increased. He wants to make an investment to increase his stock and take advantage of the increase in demand, but he does not have the necessary capital to do so. That is why he has requested a loan through Yehu, so that he can buy basic detergents, sugar, instant food products, bread, snacks, etc. 

Rumba has good credit references, is very responsible, and promises to pay off the loan. He is confident that he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic detergents, sugar, instant food products, bread, snacks, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and a farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and three children. Two of her children are in school. She has been in farming for seven years and produces tea and coffee and sells them to the people around her local area.

Mary is requesting a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow, which will help in boosting her income and uplifting her living standards. It will also help her in managing to pay school fees for her children. She plans to start selling cereal as an additional source of income.

Drought, pests, and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

Mary feels that Juhudi Kilimo is the best microfinance institution for small scale farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bouchiratou Adun-Ola's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Bouchiratou la responsable est âgée de 40ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement de 20ans et 11ans. Elle vend de divers depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire les exigences de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle souhaiterait aider son mari dans la construction de leur maison. Bouchiratou se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of two women who are taking a solidarity loan together, offering mutual guarantee to each other.  

Bouchiratou, the leader of the group, is 40 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children who all attend school.  Her oldest and youngest children are 20 and 11 years old respectively.  She has been selling various goods for a few years, stocking up at a market in Benin.

In order to increase her capital and to meet her customers' expectations, Bouchiratou has applied for and obtained financial support from Finadev.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's education.

Bouchiratou would like to help her husband with the building of their house.  In the photo, she is the woman featured on the left-hand side.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of milk cartons, 1 sack of rice and 5 boxes of canned tomatoes.

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 19 years. He is single and lives with four family members, one of whom is employed.

Taha owns a stationary shop. He differentiated his business by adding CDs and DVDs to the shop. He established his business in 2010, and now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting an $1,800 youth loan to buy a photocopier. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, and all her children go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells passion fruit juice, soda and other soft drinks at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy crates of soda, passion fruits and pineapples for making juice. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a big fridge so as to start selling cold drinks and also buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, passion fruits and pineapples for making juice.

loans.name: Vicenta Aurora

texts.es:
VICENTA AURORA tiene 49 años de edad de estado civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con el esposo en la ciudad de Ventanas provivncia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

VICENTA AURORA se dedica a la siembra de maíz en terrenos propios y una parte arrendados, el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, fungicidas, ranger, líquido mata maleza para evitar las enfermedades.  Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El crédito le ha apoyado para seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura. El sueño es contar con buena salud para seguir trabajando con la ayuda de la esposa. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Vicenta Aurora is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has no children. He lives with his spouse in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Vicenta Aurora is a member of the September 24th Communal Bank, which is located in the San Gabriel neighborhood in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farming and livestock breeding.

Vicenta Aurora grows corn on land that she owns and on some that she rents. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds, fungicides, Ranger (a brand of herbicide), and liquid weed killer so that she can prevent crop diseases. Her purchases are conducted in the city of Ventanas. This loan will help her to continue investing in her farming activities. Her dream is to maintain good health so that she can continue working and helping her husband.

In her free time, Vicenta Aurora enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fungicides, herbicide, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Saidia Michael

texts.en:
Sandia is a 36-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 4 and 10. All of them go to school.

Sandia runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase sugar, beans, and many other items. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Sandia has no other source of income besides this business.

In 5 years, Sandia would like to expand her business. Sandia says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, sugar, beans, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 23-year-old married man. He describes himself as a humble man. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, steel wire, margarine, cooking fat, etc. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the business environment and often power blackouts. He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern, which he will use in his retail store premise at night for lightning and charging cell phones for the customers. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful businessman. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en: Safaa is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 24 years old, single and lives with six family members, one of whom is employed. Safaa owns a shop for car spare parts. He established his business in 2005 and now he has an employee. He earned good experience in this field and has a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting a $2400 youth loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop

loans.name: Tombek Tongun

texts.en: Tombek is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 12 years old.  All of them go to school. Tombek runs a clinic and has been in business for four years. He has two employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. He is taking a loan of 5,000 SDG to purchase syrups, tablets, and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income. In five years, Tombek would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices. Tombek says he is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more drugs likes syrups, tablets etc.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is from Vani district. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children (6 and 10 years old). The children go to the local school. Her husband is a builder and gets a monthly salary. Nona runs an agricultural business. In particular, she has a nut garden and does all relevant seasonal work to ensure a good harvest. The family sells on average 1,000 kg of nuts per year. Additionally, Nona is a tutor and teaches math to private students. She works hard to do her best for the family.

Nona requested a loan to cultivate agricultural land, plant nut saplings and lay out the nut garden. The family will work hard to receive a good quality of harvest. The harvested nuts will be sold and this will increase the family income. With the increased income, Nona plans to purchase cattle and expand the family agricultural business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate agricultural land and plant nut saplings

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 24 years, single and lives with a family of seven members, three of whom are employed. 

Amir owns a barber shop. He established his business in 2010. He has acquired this profession by working as an employee in several barber shops. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. Amir is requesting a 2,400 USD youth loan to buy a small generator and a specialized chair for the barber shop. He also wants to make signage for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a specialized chair for the barber shop. He also wants to make signage for the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat from herders

loans.name: Satyasundar

texts.en:
Satyasundar is a 45-year-old differently able person living with his wife and two children who are in school in the small village of Odisha, India. He owns and manages a variety shop where he sells soaps, biscuits, betel, oil, spices, pickles, bread, wafers, toffees etc. and earns 6,000 INR per month.

He wants to enhance his business and add more variety of products in his shop like electric bulbs, detergents, toothpaste, toothbrushes, shampoo, talcum powder, tooth powder etc. so that he can attract more customers to his shop.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 INR to purchase more of what he sells and to add a few more products to his shop. He wants to make his children study in a good school and save some money for their future.

loans.use: to purchase electric bulbs, detergents, toothpaste, toothbrushes, shampoo, talcum powder, tooth powder etc. for his variety shop.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Self Help Group

texts.en:
The Mahalaxmi Self Help Group is a group of 14 women all living in the city of Balugaon, Odisha, India.  Balogaon being only 1 km away from Chilika Lake, villagers rely heavily on the lake for fishing and other seafood related industries.  

Standing in the middle in a red and yellow sari with her hand on her hip, Jhunu is the president of the group. Jhunu lives with her fisherman husband.  Jhunu and her self help group members request a loan of Rs 210,000 to purchase fishing nets, iceboxes for fish storage, and preservatives to keep the fish fresh. The women also prepare dried fish along with fresh fish to sell in the local markets.

loans.use: to pay for fishing nets, iceboxes and preservatives

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 29 years old, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Kasem owns a shop for electrical supplies. He was a partner in a similar business, but in 2009 he established his own business and he now has one employee. He built a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. Kasem is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan to renovate the shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Tutu

texts.en:
Tutu is a 23-year-old differently able man living with his parents in Balugaon village in Odisha, India. He is engaged in the activity of running a variety store in his village, where he sells biscuits, wafers, betel, tobacco sachets, incense sticks, spices, oil, toothbrushes, shampoo etc.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 INR to purchase more stock of what he sells and to add a new product to his shop like soft drinks. He says that doing so will increase his monthly income. He wants to give his parents a quality life and save some money for his future.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, wafers, betel, tobacco sachets, incense sticks, spices, oil, toothbrushes, shampoo soft drinks etc. for his variety shop.

loans.name: Rose David

texts.en:
Rose is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 10. All of them go to school.

Rose runs a restaurant, and has been in business for 5 years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase meat, beans, and other items. Besides this business, Rose has no other source of income. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

In 5 years, Rose would like to expand her business. Rose says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva. 

Note, the other person in the photo is a customer.

loans.use: to buy more items like meat, beans, fresh fish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for animal sales business

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur is married and has one child. Teymur is 33 years old. To improve his business, he needs 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to buy women's bags and shoes for sale. He has had this shop selling women's shoes for the last 2 years, but now he wants to sell women's bags too. He tries all the time to improve his monthly income in order to support his family. Teymur lives in the Baku region with his wife and child. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli.

loans.use: to buy women's bags

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth and foam to make bicycle seats

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 22 years old, single and lives with a family of seven members, two of whom are employed. Mohamad owns a mobile phone shop. He established his business in 2008 and now he has one employee. He differentiated his business by adding photocopying service to the shop. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting a $3000 youth loan to buy a generator and install rolling shutters for the shop. He also wants to make a sign for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator, install rolling shutters and make a signfor the shop.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon was born in 1949. He has been farming for 12 years to earn a living. He has managed to improve his farming business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya. Simon has also improved his entrepreneurial skills because he has been trained on business management skills. His desire is to improve from traditional methods of farming and use modern methods so as to improve his farm yields. Simon plans to buy a water tank for water storage for farm use. Hence, he has requested 21,700 KES to buy a water tank.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 27 years, married, but still doesn’t have any children. He is the only provider for the family.

Ali owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2011 in a rural area where competition is minimal. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. Ali is requesting an 1,800 USD loan to install rolling shutters for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to install rolling shutters for the shop.

loans.name: Ndegwa

texts.en:
Ndegwa lives in the town of Samburu. He has five children for whom he strives tirelessly to provide with a life of dignity that is free from want. 

Ndegwa owns a grocery store in his home, where he has worked with his family for more than two years. It is important to point out that in addition to his grocery store, he also has a vegetable garden that provides vegetables for home consumption and also some to sell.

Ndegwa is asking for the loan to buy flour, rice, detergents, sweets and other supplies to keep his store well-stocked. 

He is grateful for the opportunity he is getting, because thanks to it he will be able to stay in business and support his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, detergents, sweets and other supplies to keep his store well-stocked.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is 35 years old. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli, now living in Baku region with his wife and two children. 

Azer is a farmer and has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 3 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh fruits and vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Azer sells his crop to vegetable shops. 

As these products are in high demand, Azer wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. Now he needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma lives with his wife and six children. He sells fruits and vegetables including mangoes, cabbages, oranges and tomatoes, among others. He sells in a small locale that is an extension of his residential house. He’s very well known in the entire community and has gained a good clientele that prefers him because his products are fresh, top quality and affordable. With unequalled service, he’s always at his customers’ disposal.

Tsuma is noted for his great kindness. He’s an energetic man dedicated to his work and has many goals to reach. He’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will make it possible for him to attain success. His greatest secret is his efforts and love of work. He knows that he’ll reach his goal this way.

Tsuma is requesting this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, cabbages, oranges, among others.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, cabbages and oranges, etc

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: Juan, tiene 68 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su esposa, una hija y nietos en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua. Don Juan ha sido agricultor, el decidió establecer su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos, donde vive es una zona productora de miel de abeja. hace 12 años que don Juan compra miel de abeja en barril y la distribuye en botellas para vender por litros, también vende el polen de abeja en botes de vidrio pequeños. Además en su casa tiene una pulpería para la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, que es administrada por su esposa. La venta de miel la realiza a orilla de la carretera donde hay circulación de vehículos y clientes. Esta solicitando a ODEF el noveno préstamo, el cual es por 10,000 lempiras y lo utilizara para la compra de la miel, polen para la venta y para compra de productos alimenticios para surtir la pulpería. Su  plan es mantener el negocio, mejorar las ventas y que siempre sea su fuente de ingresos hasta su vejez.
texts.en:
Juan is 68 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his wife, a daughter, and his grandchildren in a neighborhood of Taulabe, Comayagua.

Don Juan was a farmer, but he decided to establish his own business so that he could generate better income. He lives in an area that is known for producing honey. Twelve years ago, Don Juan began buying honey by the barrel that he would transfer to liter bottles for sale. He also sells bee pollen in small glass jars. In addition, Juan has a convenience store in his home where he sells basic household products. His wife manages the store.

Juan sells honey along the side of the highway where there are many vehicles and customers. He is requesting his ninth loan from ODEF in the amount of 10,000 HNL. The money will be used to buy honey and bee pollen to sell. He will also acquire food products to restock his convenience store. His plans include maintaining his business and improving his sales so that he will always have a source of income until he retires.

loans.use: to buy barrels of honey, bee pollen, and food products to restock his store.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат  женат   имеет четверых  детей.  Он занимается животноводством более 10 лет. К сожалению по стечению обстоятельств он не смог учится в высшем учебном заведении и получить образование поэтому он занимается этим видом деятельности. Шухрат начал свой бизнес с 2 голов скота, теперь у него их 5. Дома у него есть дойная корова и его жена продает молоко соседям. Это является единственным доходам в их семье поэтому они стараются расширять свой бизнес. На полученный кредит Шухрат планирует купить несколько голов крупно рогатого скота. Он благодарит Арванд за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is married and has four children. He has been working in animal husbandry for more than ten years. Unfortunately, circumstances were such that he could not go to university and continue his education. Hence, he works in this field. 

Shuhrat started his business with only two cattle, but now he has five. He also has a dairy cow at home and his wife sells milk to their neighbors. These jobs provide their family's only income, so, Shuhrat is trying to expand his business. Upon receiving a loan, he plans to purchase a few heads of cattle. He thanks Arvand for their financial assistance and support.

loans.use: to buy a cattle

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFEPEB est formé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Jeanne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Jeanne est âgée de 54 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Jeanne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à sa charge. Jeanne vit avec ses enfants, et assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Jeanne a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Depuis une vingtaine d'année, Jeanne exerce comme activité, la vente de divers dans sa boutique ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Jeanne désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Jeanne sollicite, ensemble avec le second membre du groupe AFEPEB, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Afepeb group is composed of two people who live in the same area of Benin. The representative of the group, named Jeanne, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the first time that the group has asked for financial support from Alidé to see an increase in their level of business. 

Jeanne is 54 years old and no longer lives with her husband. She is a mother of 4 children, all who have been to school. Two of her children are still under her care. Jeanne lives with her children and alone takes care of the different household expenses. She attended school until the secondary level. 

For the last 20 or so years, Jeanne has been selling various goods in her shop. This allows her to meet her family's needs without too much difficulty. In order to respond better to customer needs, Jeanne wants to increase the stock of her products and raise her level of business. To do this, Jeanne is asking, together with the second member of the Afepeb group, for this first loan through Alidé.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 1 Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Karima (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans. Karima est mariée à un certain Janvier et a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Karima vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Karima vend depuis une six ans, des ustensiles de cuisine et divers produits par le système de distribution. Karima s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Karima sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Gbenonkpo 1 is a group of three people who live in the same district in Benin. The representative of the group, Karima (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 29 years old. She is married to a man called Janiver and has two children to support, one of whom attends school. Karima lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. In order to cover all these expenses, Karima has for the past six years been selling kitchen utensils and other products via the distribution system. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand, increasing her working capital and boosting her business, Karima is, together with the other members of the Gbenonkpo 1 group, requesting a first loan from Alidé. This loan will be used to respond better to customer demand and to make more money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase strawberry, raspberry and blackberry seedlings

loans.name: Alexandrine Bernadette's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Alexandrine Bernadette la responsable est âgée de 37ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 12ans et 8ans. Couturière de profession, elle a un atelier où elle coud des habits depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Dans le but de bien équiper son atelier afin de vite libérer les tissus des clients et de maximiser son profit, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev. Le surplus dégagé lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'aider son mari à achever la construction de leur maison. Alexandrine Bernadette se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group made up of two people who have joint liability. Alexandrine Bernadette, who is responsible for the group, is 37 years old. She is married and mother to two children who attend school. The eldest is 12 years old and the youngest eight. A dressmaker by trade, she has had a workshop, where she makes up clothes, for several years and she gets her supplies in one of the surrounding markets. With a view to fit out her workshop so that she can free up her customers' fabrics as quickly as possible and maximise her profit, she has sought a loan from Finandev. The profit she makes will enable her to contribute to her children's schooling costs and to help her husband finish building their house. Alexandrine Bernadette is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie lives in the Coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is a single business lady who runs a shop that has been operating for the last three years. In this shop, she sells, sugar, bread, flour etc. She obtained money from her mother to start the business immediately after completing high school.
Winnie was introduced to Milango by an employee and joined the group in order to access funding for her business. She is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase additional retail stock like sugar, flour, milk etc and also to pay for her college fees.
The challenge has been the high cost of retail stock. Winnie intends to continue with her business in order to obtain money to pay for her college fees and also assist the other members of her family in the various needs.

loans.use: To buy new stock of groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more timber and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a computer and laminator for the business.

loans.name: Jacqueline Tété's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Jacqueline Tété la responsable est âgée de 30ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgé a 4ans. Vendeuse de boîtes de conserve, des plateaux d'œufs et d'autres articles depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci dans d'accroître son fonds de roulement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de renforcer son stock de marchandises et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Jacqueline Tété se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of 2 women who are joint guarantors. Jacqueline Tété, the group leader, is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children who go to school. The eldest child is 9 years old and the youngest, 4.

A seller of canned goods, trays of eggs and other items for several years, Jacqueline Tété gets her supplies at one of Benin's markets. In order to increase her working capital and respond well to her customer demand, she has requested and received a microloan from Finadev, so that she can increase her inventory and help her children get an education.

Jacqueline Tété is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: to buy 50 trays of eggs, 10 boxes of sardines and 2 boxes of stock cubes.

loans.name: Enedy

texts.en:
Enedy is 22 years old, married and blessed with a six-year-old child.  She runs a cafeteria and does mobile phone charging to earn extra income.  Besides this, she is a farmer. She has employed one person in her business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been empowered financially.  This has helped her to grow her business.

Enedy needs a loan of 13,449 KES to buy a solar power pack. This will help her to light her business and charge mobile phones, hence saving on electricity costs.

loans.use: to buy a solar power pack.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy scrap for a scrap-selling business.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 27 years old, married and has three children. He has a motorbike transport business to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years.  He also does farming, mainly growing maize.  He has managed to grow his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Erick hopes to expand his motorbike transport business in the future.  He needs 12,900 KES to buy a solar power pack.  This will help him to light his house and even charge his mobile phone.

loans.use: to buy a solar power pack.

loans.name: Anne-Marie's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Anne-Marie la responsable est âgée de 32ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés, l'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 12ans et 8ans. Spécialisée dans la vente de tomate en boîte, de poisson et de divers depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Soucieuse d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle envisage aider son mari dans la construction de leur maison. Anne-Marie se retrouve à gauche dans la photo
texts.en:
This is a group of 2 people who are joint guarantors. Anne-Marie, the group leader, is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children who attend school. The eldest and youngest are 12 and 8 years old, respectively.

Having specialised in selling tinned tomatoes, fish and other items for several years, Anne-Marie gets her supplies at one of Benin's markets. Seeking to enlarge her supply capacity and to satisfy her customer demand, she has requested and received a microloan from Finadev, so that she can maximise her profits and help her children get an education. She intends to support her husband with the construction of their house.

Anne-Marie is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of fish and 10 boxes of tinned tomatoes.

loans.name: Wendtoin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ASSETO représente le groupe WENDTOIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants car un n’est plus.  Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge. 

Mme vend du poisson et du pain depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Dassasgo au secteur 28 en ville. Ses clients sont partout surtout les élèves.

Elle veut s’acheter  01carton de poisson par jour et du pain.

Avec ses bénéfices, Elle veut renforcer son activité. Comme ambition, elle a ouvert un compte pour épargner afin de pouvoir s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Asseto is the Wendtoin group representative. She is married and now the mother of 5, as one of her children has passed away. The eldest child is 25 years old and the youngest, 6. Two of her children go to school and she has 5 dependents in her household.

Asseto has been selling fish and bread for 12 years. She gets her supplies at the Dassasgo market in the town's 28th district. Her customers are primarily students. She would like to buy one box of fish a day, and some bread. She would like to use her profits to strengthen her business. She also hopes to buy a motorbike, and has opened a savings account with that goal in mind.

loans.use: to buy one box of fish a day, and some bread.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is married and has 3 children. Rashid is a 35-year-old IDP (internally displaced person) who now lives in a Baku region IDP settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has grown seasonal vegetables for the last year. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Rashid sells his crop from his garden. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Rashid wants to expand his business and produce more vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 2000 AZN. With it, he will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

This is Rashid's second loan. He is very thankful to Kiva and the lenders for helping him. Rashid changed his business and now he needs Kiva's help for improving his new business.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cigarettes and soft drinks to sell in her son's kiosk.

loans.name: Scholar

texts.en:
Scholar is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as hardworking and warm. 

Scholar operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located near a bus station and her primary customers are local residents, conductors, drivers and passengers. She describes her biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. 

Scholar will use the KES 29,990 loan to buy a water dispenser and a refrigerator. Her business goal is to run a bigger and better restaurant within five years. In the future, she hopes to improve her business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser and refrigerator.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and married with three children. He does mixed farming to earn a living.  He has been farming for three years.  

Through the financial education training conducted by Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business.  

James hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. He needs a loan of 12,900 KES to buy a solar-powered pack to light his house.

loans.use: To buy a solar-powered pack.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 47 and lives with her six children. She has a cafe where she sells African dishes and some beverages. She’s had this business for several years and she’s attained quite a bit of sales experience that has led to her earning good profits. 

Jane is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work. She’s always on the lookout for alternatives that will lead to a more profitable future, which is why she strives daily to the maximum degree to reach her objective. She wants to add to her stock of ingredients but lacks sufficient capital to do so, which is why she’s asking Yehu for a loan to buy goods such as flour, cooking oil, meat and vegetables. Jane is confident she will be able to repay the loan and has faith that she’ll provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her cafe, such as flour, cooking oil, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 55 years old, married, and has 10 children, two of whom are married and eight of whom attend school. To provide for his family, he is a farmer.  Through the financial support from Faulu Kenya, he has managed to expand his business.  

Joseph is requesting a loan for 12,900 KES, which he will use to buy a solar power pack for lighting his house. His desire is to practice large-scale farming in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a solar power pack.

loans.name: Susannah

texts.en:
Susannah is 46 years old, married, and has five children who attend school.  She lives in Buchanan. Her husband is a business man.  Susannah sells rubber slippers, blouses, and used shoes in the market. 

Susannah is requesting a loan, which she will use to to purchase more slippers, blouses and used shoes for her business. She hopes to have her own house and attend vocational school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, blouses, and used shoes.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en: Caro is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy balers of flour, sugar, cooking fat, and sodas. Since her previous loan, her living standards have improved. She hopes to expand her business into a bigger shop. Caro is grateful to Yehu and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase balers of flour, sugar, cooking fat, and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
This is Julita. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julita hopes that her business will grow and dreams to have their own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making fried chicken.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Муж Замиры вместе с сыном находятся в Российской Федерации. Замира работает в ателье, она портниха. Она занимается шитьем платьев. В этой области Замира имеет богатый опыт. Она берет кредит для покупки материалов, тканей и ниток. Замира хочет сшить национальные платья для продажи.
texts.en: Zamira lives in Istaravshan. She is 41 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband and son are currently in the Russian Federation. Zamira is a seamstress and works in a sewing studio where she makes dresses. She has a wealth of experience in this area. Zamira is seeking a loan to purchase materials, fabrics and thread. She wants to sew national dresses to sell.

loans.use: To buy materials, fabrics and thread

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 46 years old, married and has five children who attend school.  She lives in Buchanan. For the past 20 years, she has been selling bitter ball, pepper, okra, and eggplant in the local market. 

Marie is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more bitter ball, pepper, okra,and eggplant for her business. In the future, she plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball, pepper, okra, and eggplant.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren is 68 years old and lives with his wife in the Sukhbaatar district in Mongolia. His children are married and have moved out of their parents' house. 

In 2003, he started his transporting business using his mini-bus. Myagmarsuren transports coal and firewood in the winter and provides moving services for households during summer. He is a well experienced driver. He has many regular customers. 

He is starting to operate his own business of coal and firewood retail. Since he has been transporting people's coal and firewood for long time, he knows how to thrive in the sector. He is asking 2,000,000 MNT to purchase coal and firewood wholesale and sell it at retail prices. He has good record of eight loans with timely repayment at Xacbank.

loans.use: To purchase coal and firewood wholesale and sell it at retail prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Гулом проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Гулом вместе со своей женой занимается животноводством. Он разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Гулом почти каждый день отправляет скот на пастбище. В этой области он двадцать лет. Гулом берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Gulom lives in Istaravshan. He is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. He and his wife are engaged in animal husbandry and raise livestock at home. Gulom leads his animals to pasture nearly every day. He has been doing this type of work for twenty years. Gulom is seeking a loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 55 years old, married and has four children. She is from Tabid, Ozamiz City. 

Bienvenida has cultivated coconuts for 11 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Bienvenida joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP, which will be used to pay for the costs of farm maintenance. Bienvenida plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of coconut farm maintenance.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is from the small town of Manglisi. He is 36 years old and lives with his wife, mother and two children. His mother is a pensioner. 

Vazha works as an artisan and a fireman. His job takes a lot of time and energy, but he still finds time for the family’s business. He has two milk cows, which he uses to produce yogurt and sell it locally.  

Vazha is a very hardworking young man, with a great desire to get ahead. 

With the requested loan, Vazha will renovate his existing house, which is old and damaged. Vazha will purchase building materials and renovate his home. After the house is repaired, he will rent the house during the tourist season and earn an income. With the increased income, Vazha will expand his tourist business and improve the living conditions of the family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate his rental property.

loans.name: Nasanjav

texts.en:
Nasanjav is a 44-year-old woman who and lives with her husband and six children in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt) in the Sukhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband helps her business. All her children are secondary school students. 

She has been managing a coal, firewood and pine nut retail business since 2004. She is well experienced in the sector and has many regular customers. She has taken 10 loans before this from Xacbank and made repayments according to the installment plan. 

Nasanjav is planning to start providing taxi service. Her husband will be operating the taxi. She is asking 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a taxi car for her husband's business of taxi service. She is an optimistic and hardworking person.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her husband's new taxi business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, 23, is married and from the town of Msambweni. She’s blessed with two children of opposite gender. Monica is very hardworking and has her own retail shop that is well-stocked. Her business started out with a little capital, which added to the good customer service she provides has led to its growth.

She requests a loan to buy supplies for her store at wholesale prices to meet customer demand, increase sales and as a result, increase her income. She wants to buy baked goods, sugar, flour, sodas, etc. She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because it will be of much help for her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, sugar, flour, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha operates a food stall that has been active for the last six years. She is a married mother of three children who are currently attending a local school. At the moment, she is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients like wheat flour, food flavors and rice, among others. This will allow her to obtain the best income. 

Asha’s aspiration is to provide a better quality of life for her family by developing her business and helping them obtain what they need the most.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, food flavors and rice, among others.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 38 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives in Buchanan. Her husband is an electrician.  For the past 18 years, she has been selling rice, oil, and pepper in the market. 

Rebecca is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is from the Mtskheta district of East Georgia. He is 52 years old and lives with his wife and a son. Vazha is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, he owns a greenhouse, where different kinds of greens and cucumbers are grown. He does all relevant agricultural business to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold at capital city open markets. 

Vazha is a very hardworking man, with a great experience in his work. He requested a loan to expand the greenhouse. Vazha will purchase building materials and cover the greenhouse properly to keep the needed temperature. He will sow more vegetables and greens and sell more products. This will significantly increase the family income, and Vazha will be able to reinvest the profit in his agricultural activities. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and expand his greenhouse.

loans.name: Kebah

texts.en:
Kebah is 32 years old and lives in Ganta. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have two children, ages 15 and 8, who are presently attending school.

For the past 10 years, she has been running a shop where she sells rice, coconut, cups, plates, spoons, batteries, etc. She makes a lot of profit since she is the only one who sells quality products in the local market. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase goods for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her business.

loans.name: Jose Gabino

texts.en:
José Gabino’s family was forced to increase their firewood use recently because of rising LP Gas costs. Collecting the wood is time-consuming and burning it results in smoke and soot. 

The clean-burning, renewable biogas produced by his new 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow his family to dramatically reduce their wood use, free up time, and reduce their environmental impact. 

Moreover, José Gabino will become self-sufficient in fertilizer production, using waste from his sheep and hens on his maize, squash, bean and oat crops. This Kiva loan is for 51 percent of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to convert livestock waste to biogas and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en: Mwanamkasi runs a juice selling business. She lives with her husband and four children. She sells daily to help her husband cater for the family's daily expenses. Currently, Mwanamkasi needs to buy a blender and more fruit varieties like mangoes, oranges, pineapples, etc. to make juice. This will allow her to have more ingredients on hand to increase her income. She wants to use the loan to make a good investment that will lead to improved solvency and capacity for the business to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy a blender and more fruit varieties like mangoes, oranges, pineapples, etc

loans.name: Sect 17 Wendaobo Group

texts.fr:
Mme VERONIQUE représente le groupe SECT 17 WENDAABO. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants.  ELLe se porte bien. Le plus âgé a 42ans et le moins âgé a 22ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge. 

Mme vend de  bois de chauffe  depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne par chargement dans les villages. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 05chargement par mois.

Mme veut  s’occuper de sa famille  avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne  agrandir son magasin de  stock.
texts.en:
VERONIQUE is the representative of the SECT 17 WENDAABO group. She is married and mother of six children. She is doing well. Her eldest child is 42 years old, and her youngest child is 22 years old. One of her children is in school, and she has three people living in her care.

VERONIQUE has been selling firewood for ten years now. She buys her supplies by the load in the villages. She has both male and female customers.

She wants to buy five loads of firewood per month.

VERONIQUE wants to use the profits to take care of her family. She is striving to enlarge her shop.

loans.use: to buy five loads of firewood per month

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: For the past year, Fatuma has been operating a juice selling business, selling from her home and at the market. She is 37, married, and a kind mother of two. Her husband Omari is also a businessman. Together they help to cater for the household expenses. Fatuma is a dedicated woman who does not fear any sought of challenge. She always believes in prosperity and hard work. She is currently asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES to buy more fruit and a blender. Her dream is to see her business flourish and open more businesses in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and a blender.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 43 year old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 14 years to 25 years. Pauline describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail store where she sells spare parts. Her business is located near a bus station and her primary customers are motor vehicle owners and conductors. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the 35,490 KES loan to buy a water dispenser and a fridge which will be used by her 10 family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and water dispenser

loans.name: Henmedeh

texts.en:
Mrs.Henmedekh is 45 yrs old man who lives with his wife and three children in small house in Orhon province, Mongolia. His wife helps his business. His daughter, Bayarmaa, is 16 years old, his oldest son, Bayarjargal, is 14 years old, and his younger son, Buyanjargal, is 3 years old. His oldest children, Bayarmaa and Bayarjargal, are secondary school students. 

He has been working at clothes selling rental counter of a shopping center as assistant salesperson since 2005. He has gained a lot of experience and built close relationships with customers. He is now starting his own clothes shop at a rental counter in that shopping center. He is a hardworking and cheerful person. He is asking for 2,500,000 MNT to cover rental fee and to purchase clothes and other goods to resell at his counter in retail price.

loans.use: To cover rental fee and to purchase clothes and other goods to resell at his counter in retail price

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Ángel is a cattle farmer in the Northeastern Mountains of Puebla and doesn’t have access to electricity due to the lack of infrastructure in his region. Using the renewable biogas produced by his 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will run a generator to provide electricity on site. His biodigester will also let him convert his cow waste into a potent organic fertilizer for use on his maize, wheat, barley and oatmeal. This Kiva loan represents 48% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives with her husband and 8 children. Together with her husband, she has been fishing and selling their fish at the market. Fatuma sells the fish in the morning when her husband comes back from fishing which mostly is done at night. In addition to this business, Fatuma sells firewood from her home. She is a woman who is dedicated to her work. 

Fatuma is active, determined, and very tenacious; day by day she strives to achieve her goals and she will not rest until she achieves the success she so greatly desires because she knows that it will bring a more prosperous future.

She is asking for this loan to buy fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini lives with her husband and two children. She runs a fuel business as a way to help her husband cover the household expenses, as well as to generate income to be able to cover other expenses. She sells diesel and kerosene from her home. It is a business she has been running for two years.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase a pump and more fuel. This loan will help her improve and boost sales.

She hopes that through this business, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life little by little, and that she will help educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase a pump and more fuel.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children who all go to school. She has one additional family member. 

She sells vegetables and fruits at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy passion fruits, watermelon and pineapples. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to the university level. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more passion fruits, watermelon and pineapples.

loans.name: Mwansada

texts.en:
Mwanansada, 28, is married and has three children. She lives in an suburban area of Msambweni. Mwansada has been selling household necessities in a grocery store for the past one year. She stocks basic products like shampoo, detergents, sodas, flour, etc.

At present she’s requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy cooking oil, beans, rice, corn flour and soft drinks. She believes that the loan will help her better stock her store and increase sales. Her future goal is to open a bigger store to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, beans, rice, corn flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en:
Mrs.Tsolmon, 47 years old, lives with her husband and a 12-year-old girl in their wooden house in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She works as a plasterer in a local construction company, and her husband is a taxi driver. 

In winter, her family uses a coal-burning stove to overcome the winter. Every day, she gets up at 5 and goes to sleep at 12 to burn the coal; if not, the house gets cold. A smoke, generated from the stoves, is polluting the atmosphere and threatening people’s health and the environment. So Tsolmon is requesting 5,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to connect her house to the central heating system, which is located not far from her house. She told us that if people want to connect their house to the central heating system, they need to spend a lot of money and time to get a number of permissions from the city administration. She has been waiting for this moment for the last three years. By doing this, her family will live in more comfortable conditions and won’t use the coal to warm the house.

loans.use: To connect her house to the central heating system.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is asking for another loan so as to invest in the existing business. He plans to replace his generator and buy a new DVD player. He is thankful for the previous loan, which boosted his business. 

He hopes to expand his business and open a retail shop in the near future.

loans.use: to replace his generator and buy a new DVD player.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantsetseg, 49, lives with her 19 year-old son in a two-room apartment in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her son studies at a local university. She has been running a hair dressing salon. 

In 2008 she started her business with 2 hair dressers by renting 50 square meters. During the last 4 years, her salon has become popular and has lots of permanent clients. As the number of clients grows, clients need more services and require high standards. So, Narantsetseg is planning to renovate the equipment that is being used in the salon to meet her clients' expectations and requirements. 

In the future, she wants to buy the place where she is doing her business and to expand her business to become a beauty salon offering all types of services relating to beauty.

loans.use: to renovate the equipment that is being used in her barber shop.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Bovel district of Battambang province, Ra is 44 years old and a farmer. She has five children, all of whom are still dependent on her as two of them are still in school and the other three are helping the family business. Her average daily income is up to 29,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has been with for 10 years.
