Ra's group consists of two members who seek a new loan as first-time borrowers. As group leader, her loan portion will be used to buy material for building a decent latrine for her household. She hopes to own a proper latrine to promote healthy practices for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a latrine.

loans.name: Malimba Women Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the Malimba group for the second time. These borrowers had finished repaying their last Kiva loan successfully and are applying for a new loan to further develop their respective businesses. The previous Kiva loan made a huge impact in their lives and business. Their leader, Bondu, sells plastic containers like bowls, buckets, cups, etc. With the help of the previous loan, he experienced a boom in his business. With the help of this new loan, he is again going to buy more bowls, buckets, cups, etc. to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy more bowls, buckets, cups, etc. for his plastic container business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a very responsible and reliable person. She has a very united family made up of her husband and her three children who are studying.

Asha has a food stall. It is difficult work, but with it, she has been able to move forward. Thanks to all these efforts, Asha gives her husband the help he needs with the household expenses. She is applying for a loan from Yehu to be able to buy more ingredients like flour, beans, cheese, sugar, and others to prepare more foods.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, beans, cheese, sugar, and others

loans.name: Pek's Group

texts.en:
Pek is a villager from the Bovel district of Cambodia. She is 55 years old and she supports her family through rice cultivation. She has nine children, one of whom is the school-daughter. She has been involved in her business for seven years.

Pek's group consists of three female members. Pek is the group leader. All of them are the first-cycle loan clients and seeking the same loan amount of 200,000 KHR each. 

Pek is going to use her portion to buy the necessary materials for constructing a proper latrine for her family. She hopes this purchase will bring good hygenic practices to her family.

loans.use: to buy material for building a latrine.

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en: Batzaya is 26 years old, and lives with his wife and a 4-year-old girl in his house in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. His house is located in the ger district, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. His wife has been working as a distributor in a merchandising company since 2011. Batzaya works as a driver for a local taxi service company which transports people from Darkhan to Ulaanbaatar, the capital. He has been leasing the car from his company. Every day, he has to pay $20 and drives 600 km. The car he is using has too big an engine so it uses 14 liters of gasoline/petrol per 100 kilometers. The study showed that an average car running on gasoline emits 155g of carbon dioxide per km to the atmosphere. The gasoline contains ingredients like zinc and lead that are harmful to people’s health and the environment. Economically, riding a car with a big engine in Mongolia is not rational, because Mongolia imports fuel products from its neighbors and its price always rises. So, Batzaya is asking 5,000,000 MNT to buy a car that runs on natural gas, which emits fewer harmful chemicals into the atmosphere than gasoline. On one hand, he will contribute his effort to save the environment, and on the other hand he will earn money for his family.

loans.use: to buy a car that runs on natural gas for his taxi business.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has ten children, all of whom attend school. He owns a water vending business, a business which he has been operating for over ten years. Apart from this, he owns a pool table business.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is water shortage due breakage of water pipes. 

Nathan is applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenya shillings to buy storage tanks for his water business and a pool table. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve on the living standards of his family and pay school fees for his children. His dream is to see his business grow into a bigger business and open another outlet.

loans.use: To buy storage tanks for his water business and a pool table.

loans.name: Steven Tamba J.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. These teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 4,900,000.00 Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Steven, 38, is the leader of this group of teachers. A native of Koidu, Steven is married and has five children who are attending schools. Steven has been a professional teacher for 16 years now. Apart from being a teacher, Steven is also a businessman and has been in the cosmetics business for six years now.  He has requested this loan to pay school fees for his children and invest the rest in business. He will buy cosmetics in large quantities to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and invest the rest in business. He will buy cosmetics in large quantity to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Daniel T.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), is a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. These teachers are from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They want a loan of 20,700,000.00 Leones in order to solve their immediate financial problems. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for handling the repayment on their behalf. 

Sahr, 39, is the leader of this group of teachers. He is a native of Njaiama Nimikoro, in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and has four children who attend primary and secondary school. Sahr has been in the teaching profession for 23 years now. He has requested this loan to buy building materials like sand, nails, iron corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like sand, nails, iron corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Rith's Group

texts.en:
Rith is 29 years old with one son, and is a local farmer originally from the Bovel district of Cambodia. She has been involved in rice farming for two years, and the rest of her family largely depend on this income.

Rith is leading a group with three other members, and this is their first loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund.  Her loan portion will be used to buy materials to build a proper latrine for her family's use, such as a ring lined pit with a concrete slab and a ceramic pan. She wants to have hygienic practices in her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a proper latrine

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married business lady who lives in Kilifi and sells roofing materials, commonly referred to as ‘makuti’. These items are preferred for roofing in the Kilifi area and at the coast in general since they insulate from the heat mostly experienced at the coast during the day time. Mbeyu has been running the business for twenty years. She also sells fruit. She is a mother of four mostly grown-up children; of whom the last one is in school.

Mbeyu was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of fruits, other foodstuffs and roofing materials. Her main challenge is competition.

Mbeyu will save the additional income from this loan. She aspires to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruit, other foodstuffs and roofing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional bags of charcoal to stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour and foodstuffs for the bakery.

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en:
Magaret is a poultry farmer who lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She has been in the business for the last two years. She also has two children; one of whom is in school. 

Magaret and her family also receive some income from their salaries; both Magaret and her spouse are employed.

Magaret was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings to buy chicks, feed and paraffin. The challenge in the current business is some clients not paying on time and the high cost of transportation. Her future ambition is to increase the stock of animals in her farm. This she believes will help her pay for her children’s school fees effectively.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and paraffin.

loans.name: Geswendebala De Sect15 Group

texts.fr:
Mme MINATA  représente le groupe  GESWENDEBALA DE SECT 15. Elle se porte bien ainsi que toute sa famille. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va  à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Mme fait la restauration  depuis 05ans. Son ancien crédit s’est bien déroulé. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de zeempasego yaar. Ses clients sont partout.

Mme veut s’acheter 01 sac de riz, 01 bidon d’huile (20 litres), de la pate d’arachide et du bois. 

Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses économies. Elle  a pour ambitions dans l’avenir de vendre des céréales et  aider son mari avec  les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Minata is the "Geswendebala De Sect15" group representative. She is in good health, as is the rest of her family. She is married and the mother of 2 children. The eldest is 8 years old and the youngest, 2. One of her children goes to school, and she has 3 dependents in her household.

Minata has been in the restaurant business for 5 years. Her previous loan was settled as planned. She gets her supplies at the Zeempasego Yaar market. Her clients come from everywhere.

Minata would like to buy one bag of rice, one 20-litre can of oil, some groundnut paste and some wood. She would like to strengthen her business with her savings. She aims one day to sell cereals and support her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy one bag of rice, one 20-litre can of oil, some groundnut paste and some wood.

loans.name: Prisque Ognamba

texts.fr: Agée de 39ans, Prisque Ognamba est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 11ans et 8ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des boîtes de tomate, des cartes de recharge et de divers depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire favorablement la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un appui financier à Finadev en vue de maximiser son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Prisque Ognamba is married and a 39-year-old mother of two children, both of whom attend school. Her oldest is 11 and her youngest is eight years old. She has a shop where she sells canned tomatoes, recharge cards and various other goods. She has been running her shop for several years now, and purchases her supplies at one of the markets in Benin.

In order to increase her working capital and to meet customer demand, Prisque Ognamba has sought and obtained financial support from Finadev. With this loan, she hopes to maximize her income and ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase half a case of sardines, two bags of maize, half a case of canned tomatoes, and 10 all-network recharge cards to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Aldo Felipe

texts.es: El Sr. Aldo tiene 48 años y es Soltero,   se dedica a la venta de Caramelos, chicles, dulces y algunas prendas de vestir, también vende Chips telefónicos y  tiene puntos de  llamadas que se encuentran en una  Avenida céntrica de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Aldo va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como dulces tarjetas telefónicas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital razón por la cual el cliente se vio interesado y acudió a nuestra institución, el Sr. Aldo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son La competencia que tiene el cliente por la zona es demasiada, recién el cliente está empezando con este negocio ya que antes el  era técnico electricista pero lastimosamente el negocio no le surgió ganancias por lo que tuvo que buscar otra alternativa y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería, como tarjetas de recarga y mas caramelos para poder ofrecer a los clientes, su deseo para su negocio es El Anaquel donde actualmente vende, es de su hermano y solamente se lo está prestando, el quisiera poder consolidarse en ese mercado y comprarse un puesto de venta y así de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Aldo is 48 years old, single, and sells caramels, chewing gum, sweets, and some clothing items. He also sells telephone cards and has a calling location on a central avenue in the city of La Paz.

The loan will be his 1st through this institution. Aldo will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock his business, including sweets and telephone cards. He is soliciting this loan due to a lack of capital, which is why he was interested and approached our institution.

Aldo is confronting challenges in his business, mainly the competition in the zone is too much. He began the business only recently. Previously, Aldo was an electrical technician but, unfortunately, that business failed to produce earnings and he had to look for an alternative. Aldo will utilize future loans to continue purchasing merchandise, like recharging cards and more caramels, in order to have something to offer his customers. 

Aldo's desire for the business is to remain in El Anaquel, where he is presently located. The stand he uses belongs to his brother and he is just borrowing it. He hopes to consolidate his position in this market and to buy a sales post and, thus, in this way, to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Susana Milagros

texts.es: Susana es una mujer emprendedora de 30 años de edad, soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente vive con sus padres, la cual han sido su mayor motivación para salir adelante. Susana cuenta con una panadería la cual lleva más de 06 años en este negocio. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo y trabajo a podido mejorar su vivienda y mantener su negocio. El crédito que solicito lo va invertir comprando harina y moldes para su panadería. Su mayor deseo es de instalar una tienda  en su vivienda la cual le generaría un ingreso extra.  Susana se siente feliz al saber que personas de otros países apoyan en su progreso.
texts.en:
Susana is an enterprising 30 year old woman.  She is single and has no children.  She currently lives with her parents, which has been her greatest motivation to get ahead.

Susana has a bakery, and she has had this business for over six years.  With the fruit of her effort and work she has been able to improve her home and maintain her business.

She will use the requested loan to buy flour and baking tins for her bakery.  Her biggest wish is to install a store in her house, which would generate an extra income.  Susana is happy to know that people from other countries support her progress.

loans.use: to buy flour and baking tins.

loans.name: Philomène's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Philomène la responsable est âgée de 42ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 30ans et 12ans. Elle vend des boîtes de conserve, du poisson et d'autres articles depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Soucieuse de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire afin de mieux satisfaire la demande ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra d'accroître son revenu additionnel et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Philomène se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of two women who are joint guarantors. Philomène, the group leader, is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. The eldest and youngest are 30 and 12 years old, respectively.

Philomène has been selling tinned foods, fish and other items for several years, and she gets her supplies at one of Benin's markets. Seeking to strengthen her revenue so that she is better able to satisfy her customers, she has requested and received a microloan from Finadev. This loan will enable her to increase her additional revenue and contribute to her children's education.

Philomène is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of fish, 5 boxes of sardines and 2 boxes of tinned tomatoes.

loans.name: Avila Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM  représente le groupe  AVILA. Elle se porte bien ainsi que toute sa famille. Mariée, elle est mère de 08enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 07 vont  à l’école et elle a 10 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des pagnes tissés  depuis 22 ans. Son ancien crédit s’est bien déroulé. Elle s’approvisionne au  SIAO et au marché de nabi yaar. Ses clients sont les voisins et les autres  citadins.

Mme veut s’acheter une balle de fil et de teintes.

Mme veut renforcer son activité et participer aux charges de la famille avec ses économies. Son ambition est toujours d’ouvrir un centre de formation.
texts.en:
Marima is the representative of the group AVILA. She is doing well, as is her large family. Marima is married and the mother of eight children. The oldest is 21 years old and the youngest is three. Seven of her children attend school, and she has 10 dependents in all. 

Marima has been a weaver and seller of woven cloth for 22 years. She purchases her supplies from the SIAO and at the Nabi Yaar market. Her customer base is made up of her neighbors and other townspeople. Her previous loan went well. She wants to use her current loan to purchase a ball of yarn and dyes. With the income she earns, Marima wants to strengthen her business and help pay for family expenses with her savings. Her long-term goal continues to be opening a training center.

loans.use: to purchase a ball of yarn and dyes for making woven cloth.

loans.name: Gonzalo Isaul

texts.es:
GONZALO ISAUL tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en la ciudad de ventans Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

GONZALO ISAUL Se dedica a labores agrícolas a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono organico.
 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra. El sueño es comprar un terreno y un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las cosechas y el mal clima.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor .
texts.en:
Gonzalo Isaul, 27, is in a common-law relationship and has no children.  He lives with his wife in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He's a member of 24 de Septiembre Communal Bank, located in the San Gabriel area in Ventanas Canton where people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Gonzalo Isaul makes a living growing corn and raising chickens and pigs.  He's requesting the loan to buy seed, urea, insecticide, and Ranger and organic fertilizer.

With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy the fertilizer he needs for planting.  The challenges he faces are pests in his crops and bad weather.  

His dream is to buy a plot of land and a car.  In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mohamed est âgé de 28 ans, marié et père  de 2  enfant. Il  vit dans une famille nucléaire avec sa femme et ses enfants  au quartier Sébougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mohamed a abandonné les études en classe de 4ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour s’intéresser aux activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers de boutique. Il mène cette activité depuis 7 ans. Il a une maîtrise du rouage de ce secteur d’activité, sa force est due à son accueille clientèle et surtout sa souplesse envers les travailleurs de l’usine G.D.C.M. qui constituent l’ossature de sa clientèle. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa demande clientèle surtout pour la fête de tabaski  qui s’annonce où il y’a plus de demande, il sollicite ce nouveau prêt, il est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 48 mois et a déjà obtenu 4 prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés. Il est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 sacs de sucre, 3 cartons de savons et 4 bidons d’huiles,  il s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou.  
Monsieur Mohamed vend au comptant  à une clientèle composée   de femmes et d’hommes. Avec ce prêt il  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 28.000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.  Son ambition est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Mohamed, 28 years old, is married and the father of two children. He lives in a nuclear family with his wife and children in the Sébougou neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mohamed quit school in the fourth class of basic school (Malian education system) to get into retailing general merchandise. He worked in this activity for seven years. He is very experienced in this line of work, and his strength is the way he welcomes his clientele and especially his flexibility towards the workers at the G.D.C.M. factory, who constitute the backbone of his clientele. 

Wishing to satisfy the demand of that clientele, especially in view of the coming holiday, called Tabaski in Mali, where the demand for his merchandise rises, he is requesting this new loan. He has been dealing with Soro Yiriwaso for 48 months and has already had four individual loans, all correctly reimbursed. He is now on his 5th individual loan. which he plans to use to purchase two sacks of sugar, three cartons of soap, and four jerrycans of oil. He buys his supplies right in Ségou.  

Mr. Mohamed sells on a cash basis, to a clientele composed of women and men. With this loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 28,000 F CFA which will allow him to cover his family's expenses. His ambition is to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of sugar, three cartons of soap, and four jerrycans of oil for resale.

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Sol De Cupiche” empieza su 7mo ciclo,  las 08 personas que participan han demostrado responsabilidad y solidaridad con sus compañeros. En esta oportunidad conoce un poco más de Angélica, ella tiene 35 años de edad y su familia la conforman ella, su esposo y  sus 02 hijos aún menores. Angélica se dedica al alquiler de mototaxis. Dicho negocio comenzó a raíz de que su esposo viaja al extranjero, pues es él quien le apoyo en la compra de dichas motos. A sus 35 años Angélica a llegado a cumplir algunas de sus metas como mejorar su vivienda y ser propietaria actualmente de 04 mototaxis. Se siente orgullosa pues con su trabajo puede seguir apoyando con los gastos del hogar. Su último crédito lo destinará  para el mantenimiento de sus mototaxis. Su siguiente meta es el de comprarse un auto, la cual lo utilizará para brindar el servicio de transporte. El grupo “Sol De Cupiche” se siente feliz al saber que personas de otros países colaboran en su progreso. Angélica se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior, es la tercera del lado derecho viste casaca ploma.
texts.en: This is the "Sol de Cupiche" communal bank, which is starting its 7th loan cycle. The eight people who are in it have proved to be responsible and supportive towards their fellow members. On this occasion, the featured member is Angélica. She's 35 years old and her family is comprised of herself, her husband and two underage children. Angélica rents out motorcycle taxis. She started this business because her husband travels abroad, and therefore he was the one who supported her in buying said motorcycles. At the age of 35, Angélica has achieved some of her goals, such as improving her home and owning four motorcycle taxis, as she currently does. She feels proud because through her work she's able to keep on supporting her household expenses. She'll use this latest loan to do maintenance work on her motorcycle taxis. Her next goal is to buy a car, which she would offer for transportation services. The "Sol de Cupiche" group is glad to know that people from other countries cooperate with their progress. In the photo, Angélica is standing in the back. She's the third one from the right, wearing a lead-colored jacket.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on motorcycle taxis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: La Sra.  Lucy tiene 22 años, tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en la zona de Colcapirhua ella se dedica a esta actividad ya hace tres años, el oficio lo aprendió de su Mama quien también vendía ropa,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lucy es cliente nueva de la institución, la Sra. Lucy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y de temporada así  de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Lucy  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando ropa y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Lucy es una persona joven y trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Lucy, 22, has a two-year-old child.  She has made a living selling clothing in the Colcapirhua area for three years.  She learned the trade from her mother, who also sold clothing.

Lucy's a new client with the institution and this is her first loan.  She's going to use this loan to make a wholesale purchase of seasonal clothing so she has a variety to offer to her customers.  She's requesting the loan to continue improving in her business.  Lucy's going to use the profits to continue buying clothes and improving her income.

Lucy's a hardworking young person.  She's happy about this opportunity because this is the only job that allows her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing wholesale

loans.name: Afiavi Aline

texts.fr: Agée de 53ans, Afiavi Aline est mariée et mère d'un enfant qui est déjà à sa propre charge. Vendeuse de bouillie depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le bénéfice dégagé par ce crédit lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et d'acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
At 53 years old, Afiavi Aline is married and the mother of a child who is no longer her dependent. She has been selling "bouillie" (a type of hot cereal eaten at the morning meal) for the past several years. She purchases her supplies at a market in Benin.

In order to increase her purchasing power and meet customer demand, Afiavi Aline has sought and obtained a micro loan from Finadev. The income she earns due to this loan will allow her to meet her current needs, and to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of maize, one sack of millet and five cartons of sugar.

loans.name: Nuevos Emprendedores Alto Cenepa Group

texts.es: ¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el grupo Nuevos Emprendedores Alto Cenepa. Pascualina, presidenta del grupo, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos pero solamente 1 todavía esta a su cargo. Pascualina se dedica al reciclaje, compra y vende: Botellas, latas, cartón, plásticos, papel, fierro, etc. Ella empezó hace 13 años, ya que no le alcanzaban los ingresos con los que contaba, anteriormente era cocinera de un comedor popular. Pascualina va a utilizar el crédito para poder tener más capital ya que ella cuenta con varios clientes. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, por lo que quisiera contar con varios triciclos y un camión, ya que necesita transportar toda su mercadería. Pascualina es la señora que se encuentra en el centro del grupo. Esta muy contenta y agradecida por la ayuda que le están brindando, se siente con mas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This group is named “Nuevos Emprendedores Alto Cenepa”.

Pascualina is the group president. She is a single mother of five children, but only one is still under her care. Pascualina is in the recycling business. She buys and sells bottles, cans, cardboard, plastic, paper, iron, and other materials. Pascualina started this business 13 years ago because she was not earning enough income. She previously worked as a cook at a popular diner.

Pascualina will use her loan as additional capital since she already has several customers. Her dream is to expand her business, so she hopes to acquire several tricycles and a cargo truck so that she can transport all of her materials. In the photo, Pascualina is the woman standing in the middle of the group. She is extremely pleased and appreciative of the help she has received, which gives her the drive to press forward.

loans.use: to acquire more recyclable materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cement, rice and drinks.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married with two children. Myrna is 50 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Myrna has a cosmetic products business. She has had this business for a year. Each month, she earns approximately Php 2,000. 

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. Myrna requested a loan of Php 12,000 to buy additional inventory for sale. In the future, Myrna hopes to expand her business and own a display center for her cosmetic products.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for sale.

loans.name: Las Marias De San Jose Chiriju Group

texts.en:
When Las Marias de San Jose Chiriju formed a Trust Bank and realized three of their members were named Maria, it seemed only fitting to name the group Las Marias de San Jose Chirijuyu (The Marias of San Jose).  

Recently, we spoke to one of the Marias to gain insight into their Trust Bank. Maria, 48 years old, is married to a farmer and has nine children. She has farmed for many years along with her husband, Bernardo. Years ago, she was also a weaver, like many other women in her community. However, with her loans through Friendship Bridge, she has branched out and started a business selling vegetables and livestock in Guatemala City.

Maria and her husband are skilled entrepreneurs. They keep money flowing in their local economy by buying crops from farmers in their village and then transporting the crops, along with their own strawberry harvest, to the wholesale market in Guatemala City. To begin this business they used a loan to build a storage facility to safely keep the products until they were transported.  

Recently they have also started selling livestock.  A new loan would give Maria the opportunity to plant more strawberries and to buy chickens.

Maria has many goals for her business, but most of all she wants to earn income to enhance her children’s education. Her hard work is paying off as her oldest child is about to graduate from high school. Maria explains, “I completed a few years of primary school, but my parents could no longer support my education so I started working. Now, with microloans that I invest in my business, I can earn enough to keep my children in school. I am so excited that one of my children will graduate this year!” 

Maria and all of the Trust Bank members thank each individual through Kiva, for the effort made to invest in them, even without knowing them personally. Las Marias de San Jose Chiriju Trust Bank recognizes the responsibility that comes with great confidence like this.  

All eight women have created a circle of friendship and support. They are determined to stay together to enhance the lives of their families through Friendship Bridge’s microloans and education.

loans.use: to buy strawberries, seeds, and to buy chickens.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Christiana. She is married, and has 3 children, aged 3, 7 and 12. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her, a younger sister, to help with her schooling. In 1998, Christiana established her plastic slippers business. She started the business after dropping out of school, to help the husband with running the home. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Christiana requires a loan in order to buy additional plastic slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 534,480. In the future, Christiana plans to expand the business to a shop, make more profit and take care of her children's education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for plastic slippers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: This is 33 year-old Martha. She is married, and has 2 children, aged 5 and 8. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her to help with the house chores. In 2009, Martha established her drinks and recharge cards business. She began the business to help her husband with running the affairs of the home and to meet her personal needs. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Martha requires a loan in order to buy additional drinks, provisions and recharge cards. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 367,037. In the future, Martha plans to improve on the sale of provisions. She thinks the loan can increase her stock, thus making more profits.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and provisions and phone cards.

loans.name: Mujeres Las Estrellas Group

texts.en:
Eight enthusiastic and empowered women make up the Trust Bank, Mujeres Las Estrellas (The Stars Women).  They run businesses that revolve around agriculture and textiles in the lush village of San Jose Chirijuyu, Chimaltenango. This is a rural area in Guatemala full of agriculture fields, including the sweet crop of strawberries.

Within the group we find Rosa, who is 54 years old and married to a farmer. Rosa did not have the opportunity to attend school, but she and her husband make every effort to keep their four children in school so they can have a better quality of life.

Rosa’s dream is that her children will go to college. Thanks to her hard work, they are well on their way as they have already graduated from high school! Like Rosa, the other members of the Trust Bank also are working hard for their children´s benefit. If they earn an income, their children can remain in school. The women who make up the Mujeres Las Estrellas Trust Bank have 28 children combined. They are excited about the positive impact on the community that their children will have if they all complete school!
 
Rosa is a determined businesswomen and, through the years, with loans and education from Friendship Bridge, she has grown her company to employ more than twenty artisans during the high season. Rosa is a weaver, like many women in Guatemala.  She needed a unique offering to bring to the market so she started designing and developing a different kind of weaving. The design has become very popular.  With the holiday season approaching, Rosa is proactively planning to ensure that she has enough products to meet the demands of this busy season. Rosa will invest this loan in purchasing the highest quality of yarn, allowing her to produce the fashion and color that her customers demand. 

To sell the products, Rosa travels to four different cities that are located three to four hours away from her town. She has diversified her markets and now has exclusive clients to whom she sells her product on a weekly basis.

While Rosa is just one of the eight women who make up this Trust Bank, they are all just as determined. The women enjoy the monthly meetings in which a loan officer from Friendship Bridge delivers trainings and discussions about topics of interest, such as women's health, children’s rights, business administration, budgeting, and much more.  It is a time for them to learn, laugh, and get support from the loan officer and their colleagues.  

Rosa, on behalf of the Trust Bank, thanks Friendship Bridge and Kiva for the opportunity to have access to microcredit and education.

loans.use: to purchase the highest quality of yarn.

loans.name: Freddy Estuardo

texts.es:
FREDDY ESTUARDO tiene 28 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

FREDDY ESTUARDO  se dedica a la siembra de maíz en terrenos propios y una parte arrendados, el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, fungicidas, ranger, líquido mata maleza para evitar las enfermedades.  Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El crédito le ha apoyado para seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura y obtener ganancias. El sueño es contar con buena salud para seguir trabajando con la ayuda de la esposa. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Freddy Estuardo is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. He lives with his wife and son in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Freddy Estuardo is a member of the September 24th Communal Bank, which is located in the San Gabriel neighborhood in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farming and livestock breeding.

Freddy Estuardo grow corn on land that he owns and on some that he rents. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds, fungicides, Ranger (a brand of herbicide), and liquid weed killer so that he can prevent crop diseases. His purchases are conducted in the city of Ventanas. This loan will help him to continue investing in his farming activities so that the can generate income. His dream is to have good health so that he can continue working alongside his wife.

In his free time, Freddy Estuardo enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fungicides, herbicide, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Subba

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Subba. He is married and has 3 children, aged 3, 5 and 9. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him to help with the house chores. In 1994, Subba established his used bags business. The business started after coming from the provinces to be self reliant. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Subba has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to add on the school bags. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 316,710. In the future, Subba plans to improve on the sale of bags and move to a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used bags.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 53 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Melodia has a canteen and sells a variety of foods. She earns about 3000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Melodia has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her canteen business.

Melodia joined PMPC this year, 2012. In the future, Melodia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her canteen business

loans.name: Pablo Daniel

texts.es:
PABLO DANIEL tiene 52 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y con la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO SAN GABRIEL, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

PABLO DANIEL Se dedica a labores agrícolas a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, ranger, abono organico, cerdos, polbillo.
 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para la siembra. El sueño es tener una finca para la agricultura y engrandecer el negocio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es a todo obstaculo y superarce garcias al crédito.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar villa, pelota y por la noche ver televisión.
texts.en:
Pablo Daniel, 52, is in a common-law relationship and has two children.  He lives with his children and wife in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  He's a member of 24 de Septiembre Communal Bank, located in the San Gabriel area of Ventanas Canton, where people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Pablo Daniel makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice, and he also raises chickens and pigs.  He's requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, Ranger and organic fertilizer, pigs, and "polvillo" [animal feed made from rice].  With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy the fertilizer he needs for planting.

His dream is to have a farm and expand his business.  The challenges he faces are all the obstacles and improving himself thanks to the loan.

In his free time he likes to play pool and ball, and, at night, watch television.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea fertilizer, pigs, and animal feed

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 59 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin. Justina is married with two children. 

Justina has a store that sells a variety of products. Justina has had this business for 10 years. Justina requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Justina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Justina hopes to put aside a reserve in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Tersa

texts.en:
Tersa is a 49-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She is a mother of two children ages nineteen and fifteen years old.  She has been in the basket weaving business for thirty years. She sells native handicrafts like baskets made of nito (a plant material). Aside from her basket-weaving business, she raises hogs. 

Tersa plans to use the loan to buy materials for weaving such as nito, and to buy additional piglets and feed. In the future, Tersa would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to finance her children's quality education.

loans.use: to buy materials like nito (a plant used to make handicrafts), as well as piglets and feed

loans.name: Orquideas De Patzun Group

texts.en:
The eleven women who make up the Orquideas de Patzun (orchids of Patzun) Trust Bank have little formal education but have high hopes and are willing to take advantage of opportunities for personal and professional development that Friendship Bridge provides. They all live in the small town of Patzun Chimaltenango, a few hours from Guatemala City.

Each member of the Trust Bank has a business plan for their next loan. Maria Zenaida, 24 years old, has outlined a plan to enhance the products she sells in her community.

Like many Guatemalan women, Maria only has a few years of formal education. She completed the third grade before her mother abandoned the family and her father needed her help on the farm and to take care of her younger siblings. While growing up, Maria’s father taught her many lessons about agriculture. Today, Maria and her husband continue the family tradition of growing a variety of vegetables including cauliflower and broccoli.  They have four young children at home; the eldest has just completed the first grade.

Maria married her husband at the age of 18. They were both working in agriculture so, together, they continued this practice. Years later, Maria, an enterprising woman, decided to expand their business into animal husbandry. Today, they own 25 chickens and two pigs. Through buying, raising and selling animals, Maria earns extra income for the family.  With a new loan she will invest in feed for her chickens, seeds for their farm, and laying hens so she can begin selling eggs.

María’s dream is to continue to grow her businesses so she can support her expanding family. She is starting to plan for the future – she wants to transition the farm to her husband so she can open a clothing store and continue raising livestock. 

Maria and the entire Orquideas de Patzun Trust Bank appreciates the support of Kiva investors. Without microcredit, many family development opportunities would not exist in rural communities of Guatemala.

loans.use: to buy chicken food, seeds for farming, and laying hens.

loans.name: Claveles Rojas Group

texts.en:
The Claveles Rojas (Red Carnations) Trust Bank is made up of seven industrious women from Patzun, Chimaltenango.  Patzun is a community rich in agriculture and textiles; it also boasts beautiful landscapes as it is nestled in the central western region of Guatemala. 

Women in the community wear traditional colorful outfits as they go about their daily lives. The women in the Claveles Rojas Trust Bank are hardworking and run businesses that include animal husbandry, agriculture and trade.

Jeniffer Aracely, a married women and mother of three, is one of the seven women who make up the Trust Bank. Her husband works in an aluminum factory in Guatemala City. Jeniffer has sold ice cream cones for seven years. Three months ago, she decided to use her sales skills more effectively and expand her business to selling vegetables. Five days a week she sells out of her home. Recently, she decided to rent a small space at the local market so she can sell to a new audience, two days a week. “My new business is going very well.  Many customers return to me because I have good customer service.  I learned a lot about customer service from Friendship Bridge along with other topics including pricing, budgeting and even women’s health,” explains Jeniffer. 

On behalf of the Claveles Rojas Trust Bank, Jeniffer thanks the Kiva investors.  “We appreciate the financial investment in our businesses and are excited as this helps improve the quality of our lives,” says Jeniffer.

loans.use: to invest in selling vegetables and ice cream cones.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 44 year-old Mohamed. He is married, and has 5 children, aged 3, 6, 12, 16 and 21. In 1998, Mohamed established his used shoes business. The business started to be self-reliant and enabled him to take care of his family. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy three bales of used school shoes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 382,800. In the future, Mohamed plans to improve the kiosk and to expand. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used shoes.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.en:
Jeny is a 39-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has no child yet. She has been in the hog-raising business for three years. Aside from the hog-raising business, she has a sari-sari (variety store) business.  She sells items like soft drinks, coffee, noodles, and soap. 

Jeny plans to use the loan to buy feed, additional piglets, and merchandise like soft drinks (Coke and Pepsi), noodles, coffee and soap. She earns four thousand a month by doing both hog raising and running the sari-sari store. In the future, Jeny would like to expand her business so as to be successful.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, soft drinks, noodles, and coffee

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona is a 44-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has three children, ages fourteen, twelve and ten years old. She has been in the hog raising business for three years. She plans to use the loan to buy feed such as hog starter, hog grower mash and hog finisher. Her husband, a security guard, helps finance their daily needs.

Simeona earns six thousand a month by doing the hog raising business. Simeona would like to expand her business to support her family and to send her children to school to have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is widowed with three children. Fernando is 41 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement, Tudela.

Fernando is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 8 years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional coconut wine to sell. 

Fernando has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Fernando hopes to save funds in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Ukux Kem Group

texts.en:
In the rural community of Chuanoj, outside of Totonicapán Guatemala, Kiva investors can find the Ukux Kem (heart of weaving) Trust Bank. The Trust Bank is comprised of 11 amazing women who have been part of Friendship Bridge’s Microcredit Plus program for five loan cycles. The Ukux Kem Trust Bank is aptly named as the women weave several products to sell including tablecloths, napkins, and traditional shirts.  

Hermelinda Josefina is a 23-year old woman and a member the Ukux Kem Trust Bank. Despite coming from a large family of ten siblings, she was able to attend high school, study secretarial skills and receive a diploma. Upon graduating, she searched tirelessly for a secretary position but with the economic crisis, she could not find one. Being single at the age of 23, she still needed an income to survive and help her parents care for the younger siblings. 

She and her two brothers started a textile business, making cortes (traditional skirts) for several different cultures. Their products are so beautiful that they soon found a customer who consistently orders from them. It was clear their business was growing and they needed capital to keep up with supply.  Hermelinda found Friendship Bridge and the Ukux Kem Trust Bank.  

With her loan, Hermelinda will buy yarn in bulk and start working in orders for Christmas products. “I am so grateful for this loan. My brothers and I have the desire to make our business bigger but it is not possible without money,” explains Hermelinda.  “Once we earn extra profit, we will start to save to open a family bakery.”
 
Hermelinda enjoys the monthly meetings with the Ukux Kem Trust Bank. The Trust Bank receives educational lessons from the loan officers on topics including women's health, self esteem, children's rights, business administration, customer service, and budgeting. This helps all the women manage their businesses and remain competitive in the market. The women would like to thank each and every one of the people who invest in them through KIVA.  “Without them,” explains Hermelinda, “there would be no micro-credit opportunity for us, and business development would be very slow.”

loans.use: to buy yarn in bulk and start working in orders for Christmas,

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 48 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin. Conchita has a store that sells a variety of products, which she has been doing for seven years.

Conchita is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.  She has been a member of PMPC for four months.  In the future, Conchita hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.en:
Maria Marcelina is a 54-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She is the mother of a twenty-year-old son. She has been in the hog-raising business for  five years. Her husband is a carpenter. She earns four thousand a month by doing the hog-raising business.

Maria Marcelina requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional feed such like hog grower pellets and pig supplements like anti-anemia for her pigs to grow healthy. In future, Maria Marcelina would like to expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Reneria

texts.en:
Reneria is a 50-year-old married woman and mother of a 14-year-old child from Antequera, Bohol. She has been in the motorcycle transport business for one year. Her husband previously operated the motorcycle business. 

She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase motorcycle parts like wheels, and to fund maintenance like a monthly oil change. Reneria would like to expand her business to support her family and at the same time send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts like wheels and to fund maintenance like oil change

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a 51-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has six children. She has been in medicine-peddling  for two years. She sells medicines for headache like Biogesic; amoxicillin to treat bacterial infections like bronchitis, ears, nose and throat. She also sells food supplements like MX3,  a food supplement from  a fruit called mangosteen. Its juice become a popular health drink. 

Genara plans to use the loan to buy more medicines like Biogesic , amoxicillin, and food supplement like MX3. In the future, Genara would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more medicines  like Biogesic and amoxicillin

loans.name: Demberel

texts.en:
Mrs. Demberel, 44, lives with a 16-year-old daughter in her wooden house in the 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2001, she has been renting a meat counter in a bazaar located not far from her home. 

Demberel usually sells meat retail and if the day is her lucky day, she sells wholesale to restaurants or pubs. Demberel’s daughter studies at a lyceum. Her husband has been working as a contract worker in Korea for the last 6 years and every month he sends some money for his family. Demberel told us that she saves the money sent by her husband, to spend it for her daughter’s education. And she always requires from her girl “paying attention only to studies and become educated person”. 

In Mongolia, the academic year begins in September and parents have to pay tuition fees for their children. To solve this problem, many herders sell their livestock wholesale, so the price of the meat decreases to its lowest point. Now each day in Mongolia is getting colder and colder, so the preservation of meat is not a problem. If Demberel buys meat in large quantity, she can sell it till March. The loan, she is taking will be used to raise her current assets and buy more meat. By doing this, she can earn more income for her family and for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: To raise her current assets and buy more meat

loans.name: Nelpha

texts.en:
Nelpha is 50 years old, married, and has four children.  She is from Antequera, Bohol. She has been in the food selling  business for four years. She sells banana chips. She also raises pigs.

Nelpha is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy items like flour, bananas, oil, and feeds for her pigs. In the future, Nelpha would like to expand her business to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, bananas, oil, and feed for pigs.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.en:
Jose Ernesto is a 37-year-old married man from Corella, Bohol, Philippines. He has engaged in the copra-making business for several years now. This is the source of his income.

Jose Ernesto wants to expand his business but lacks the financial means to do so. He is now requesting for a loan to buy more coconut, sacks, and copra. Jose Ernesto hopes to make his business progressive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts, sacks, and copra (dried coconut meat)

loans.name: Ulpiana

texts.en: Ulpiana is a 50-year-old married woman from Corella, Bohol. She has six children. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for twenty years. She sells commodities like canned goods, coffee, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, soap and shampoo. She requested a loan of 21,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks (like Coke and Pepsi), canned goods, sugar, coffee, noodles, soap and shampoo. In the future, Ulpiana would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to have a stable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Toufiq

texts.en:
Toufiq is 29 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been sewing and selling furniture for two years. He is a hard worker and puts a lot of effort into improving his business in order to improve his living and develop his working zone. He started his business by selling gold and borrowing from close friends. 

Toufiq is requesting a youth loan from AMB, which he will use to stock his store with furniture to increase his income. His plan is to expand his business. He hopes to keep providing his customers the best service ever and continue improving his financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his business.

loans.name: Abduljabar

texts.en:
Abduljabar is a 24-year-old man who is single and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a person who is very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic and has a great desire to succeed. By his own initiative, and with much effort and enthusiasm, he is studying for his Bachelor's of computer science and dreams of being a professional engineer.

He intends to buy construction supplies but he doesn`t have sufficient money so he applied for a youth loan of 480,000 YER to buy construction supplies for his house. He hopes to get job and get married.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.name: The Unity Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the The Unity Group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek for a loan of 7,000,000 Leones for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Issata. Issata was born in Tonkoro, in Eastern Sierra Leone, 34 years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Issata sells cooked rice with delicious sauce. She has been in this business for seven years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), tomatoes, onions, fish, and other items in bulk. This will enable her to cook a larger quantity of rice and sauce and will also enable her stop buying at retail price. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Edward, posing with the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of cooking ingredients including rice, palm-oil, salt, pepper, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a 54-year-old married woman from Poblacion, Baclayon, Bohol. She has been in the buy-and-sell business for ten years. She buys and sells firewood and rice. She also opened a business selling fruit shakes, which she sells in the nearby school. She plans to use the loan to purchase more firewood, rice and fruits like mango, apple, pineapple and melon. In the future, Corazon would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures to be successful.

loans.use: to buy more firewood, rice and fruits

loans.name: Josette Charlotte

texts.fr: Josette est une femme qui vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Mère de famille, lle tient une vente de charbon depuis 20 ans. Grace à sa témérité elle s'est faite une grande clientèle qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de charbon. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront d'augmenter son capital et d'assurer la pérennité de son commerce tout en subvenant aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Josette is a woman who lives in a district of the capital city. She is the mother of a family and she has been selling charcoal for 20 years. Thanks to her courage, she has found a large clientele whom she would like to continue to satisfy. For that reason she has requested a loan that will permit her to grow her stock of charcoal. The profit from this loan will allow her to grow her working capital and insure that her business will continue to operate, while covering the needs of her family.

loans.use: to grow her stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg is 35 years old and has one child. She lives in her old wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her house is located in the ger district, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. She works as a water distributor at a well near her home, which she has been doing for several years. 

Naranchimeg's old house is in incredibly bad condition. Due to its old age and her lack of money, it has never been maintained. Over the last winter, she and her daughter lived in her parents' home. Burning charcoal in large quantities to overcome the cold winter days does not make sense. So, before the winter, Naranchimeg is requesting a loan, which she will use to thicken her house walls and to repair her house. She will reconstruct her house and thicken the walls with materials that keep the heat as long as possible. She will use brick to thicken house walls from the outside and basalt wool from the inside. By doing this, she can cut the usage of charcoal by several times compared to her current house.

loans.use: To make wall insulation and to repair her house.

loans.name: Ahichéhou David

texts.fr: Ahichéhou David est âgé de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Ahichéhou David est marié à une marchande du nom de Agnès. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Ahichéhou David mène comme activité depuis une douzaine d’année, la couture dans sa région. Ahichéhou David s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ahichéhou David désire acquérir une machine pour perfectionner son atelier. Pour ce faire, Ahichéhou David sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Ahichéhou David is 28 and lives in Bénin. He is married to a merchant named Agnès. They have three children, some of whom are in school. In order to manage the family's various responsibilities, Ahichéhou David has worked as a sewer for about twelve years. He buys his materials in his region. In order to provide better customer service and to increase his business and his income, Ahichéhou David wants to acquire a sewing machine to improve his workshop. In order to do so, he is requesting his fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow him to expand his business and increase his income. His first loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is a 28-year-old woman living with her parents and her 8-year-old daughter. They live in her 20-square-meter house, which was built in 2011. Her parents are pensioners and look after her daughter.

Battsetseg has been renting a counter in the city’s largest bazaar for three years. She sells socks, tights, panties and other small garments to her customers. Her business is doing well.

Now Battsetseg is seeking a loan because she is planning to extend her house to make more room for her daughter and to install a low-pressure furnace to heat the entire house, including any extension. She explains that the house expansion work can be completed in a short period of time because she has gained a lot of experience from her current house and because she will not repeat any of her prior mistakes.

loans.use: To extend her house and to install a low-pressure furnace

loans.name: Mirian Oneyda

texts.es: Mirian, tiene 54 años de edad, casada, vive en una aldea del municipio de Olanchito, Yoro junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y hace 20 años estableció su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, manteca, leche, pastas, condimentos, refrescos, jugos, ropa, y otros. Ella ha mantenido estable su negocio mediante la buena administración y la inversión de varios préstamos. Con el préstamo que solicita actualmente es el noveno ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras, el cual  lo invertirá en la compra de más productos alimenticios para tener surtido su negocio e incrementar las ventas. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio para tener una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mirian is 54 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her three children in a village in the municipality of Olanchito, Yoro department. She has always been a businessperson, and 20 years ago established her own small general store, in order to sell basic household necessities such as rice, beans, lard, milk, pastas, condiments, soft drinks, juices, clothing, and other items. 

She has maintained the stability of her business through good management and the investment of several loans. The loan she is currently requesting is her ninth, and is for 15,000 lempiras. She will use it to purchase more food products for supplying her business and increasing her sales. 

Her goal is to continue the growth of her business so that she can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food products such as basic staples, meats, soft drinks, juices, sugar, flour, medicines and other items, in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Luis Alonzo

texts.es: Don Luis tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el sector de Cofradia, del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Luis trabajaba en una empresa privada y luego de quedar sin empleo decidió junto con su esposa establecer su propio negocio de una pulpería. Ya tiene año y medio de vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como carnes, embutidos, arroz, frijoles, manteca, condimentos, pastas, pastillas, refrescos, pan, tortillas, harina, azúcar, y otros abarrotes. Luis quiere surtir más su negocio ya que tiene buena clientela y ha solicitado un préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar carnes, embutidos, refrescos, jugos, huevos, manteca, azúcar, harina, granos básicos, y otros productos de abarrotería. Esta inversión le ayudara a crecer más su inventario y satisfacer a los clientes. Su meta es seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Luis, 38, lives with his wife and four children in the Cofradía sector in San Pedro Sula municipality.  Luis used to work for a private firm and when he became unemployed he and his wife decided to open a grocery store of their own.  He’s been selling basic staples like meat, canned goods, rice, beans, lard, condiments, pasta, pills, soft-drinks, bread, tortillas, flour, sugar and other groceries for a year and a half.  


Luis wants to better stock his store because he has a good clientele and has asked for a 25,000 Lempira loan to buy meat, canned goods, soft-drinks, juices, eggs, lard, sugar, flour, basic grains and other grocery items.  This investment will help him increase his inventory and satisfy customers.  His goal is to continue working and improving the business for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a father of two school-going children. He is in the transport business, where he owns and operates a motorcycle, a business he has been in for two years. He wants to start another business, a video show.
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to join, and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is that some customers do not pay on time.
Said is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to set up a video show, i.e., buy a video machine, tapes and compact disks. The extra income from the loan will help pay for school fees.

loans.use: to buy a video machine, tapes and compact disks to start a video show business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy petrol, engine oil, etc. to add to his business

loans.name: Rebeca Elizabeth

texts.es: La joven Rebeca de 23 años de edad, es soltera labora como auxiliar contable empezó a trabajar a los 21 años, es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad pública y finanzas, con la ayuda de sus padres paga la mensualidad de la universidad ya que su salario es muy bajo, no es lo suficiente para cubrir todos sus gastos. Rebeca solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar su curso de titulación el cual es la última fase para poder culminar su profesión, lo que es su gran sueño para poder ayudar a su familia cuando obtenga mejores ingresos y ser un buen ejemplo para sus hermanos quienes están pequeños.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 23, is a young, single woman working as an accounting assistant.  She started working at the age of 21.  She’s majoring in public accounting and finances and with her parents' help is able to pay her university monthly tuition since her salary is very low and insufficient to cover all her expenses.  

Rebeca is asking for help from a loan to be able to pay for her final degree course which is the final phase to complete her professional training which is her great dream to be able to help her family when she starts earning higher income and to set a good example for her siblings who are still little.

loans.use: to pay her final course fees.

loans.name: Mario Hernan

texts.es:
MARIO HERNAN tiene 29 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres, en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.

MARIO HERNAN Se dedica a la agricultura, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono orgánico.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener más ingresos. El sueño es seguir trabajando e invertir para obtener ganancia de los productos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y las plagas en las cosechas . En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Mario Hernán, 29, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “San Francisco” communal bank located in Recinto Pantano belonging to Ventanas Canton; they are in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Mario Hernán works in agriculture and also raises chickens and pigs.  He’s requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, Ranger [herbicide] and organic manure.  With help from the loan he will be able to earn more income.  His dream is to continue working and invest in order to earn profits from his products.    

The challenge he faces is crop illnesses and infestations.  In his free time he enjoys playing Indor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, Ranger and organic manure.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 50 years old. He is a hard-working, married man with two children.

He has operated his clothing sales' business for more than 22 years. Specifically, he sells sports' and men's clothing. He acquires his products in the old trading center located in the rural area where he lives, and then he re-sells the products to customers.

He is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,300 AZN to buy a variety of additional and new clothes, including winter sportswear. This would be his second loan from VF Azercredit, and he is grateful for the financial support that helps him achieve his goals.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of additional and new clothes (e.g., winter sportswear) to re-sell to his customers

loans.name: Juan Cecilio

texts.es:
JUAN CECILIO tiene 53 años de edad es soltero tiene una hija, vive con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.

JUAN CECILIO  Se dedica a la agricultura, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono orgánico.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá  tener más ingresos. El sueño es  seguir trabajando e invertir para obtener ganancia de los productos.

. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las cosechas . En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Cecilio is 53 years old, single, and has one daughter. He lives with her in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. He belongs to the communal bank San Francisco, located in Pantano, within the canton of Ventanas. Its members work farming and raising animals.

Juan Cecilio is a farmer and also raises chickens and pigs. He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, pesticides, weed-killers, and organic fertilizer. This loan will allow him to have higher income. His dream is to continue working and invest so that he can make a profit from his products. The challenges he faces are the pests on his crops. In his spare time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, pesticides, weed-killers, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Isrrael Cecilio

texts.es:
ISRRAEL CECILIO tiene 24 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos vive con los ellos en la ciudad de ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.

ISRRAEL CECILIO Se dedica a la agricultura, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, ranger, abono orgánico, pollos.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá  tener más ingresos. El sueño es  seguir trabajando e invertir para obtener ganancia de los productos.

. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y las enfermedades en las cosechas . En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y el futbol.
texts.en:
Israel Cecilio, 24, is single and has two children; he lives with them in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “San Francisco” communal bank located in Recinto Pantano belonging to Ventanas Canton; they are in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Israel Cecilio works in agriculture and also raises chickens and pigs.  He’s requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, Ranger [herbicide] and organic manure and chicks.  With help from the loan he will be able to earn more income.  His dream is to continue working and invest in order to earn profits from his products.    

The challenge he faces is crop illnesses and infestations.  In his free time he enjoys playing Indor soccer and soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, Ranger, organic manure and chicks.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is a 33-year-old, married man. He and his wife have three children (ages 2, 6 and 8). Ramil's wife is a homemaker, but she helps her husband on the farm in her spare time.

They make a good living selling farming products and they want to further develop this business. He has applied for this loan to buy construction materials so that he can build a stall for animals. Ramil is very grateful for your support and understanding.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials so that he can build a stall for animals.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a taxi driver. She's been in this business for 13 years. Lubov has many repeat clients. Her business is going well. 

Lubov is asking for a loan of 13,000 UAH to purchase a new car that will allow her to save gas and offer more comfortable services for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for taxi sevices

loans.name: Pedro Efrain

texts.es:
PEDRO EFRAIN tiene 41 años de edad es soltero vive en casa de los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.

PEDRO EFRAIN  Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, semillas, urea, insecticidas, ranger, abono orgánico, balanceado.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá  comprar lo que tanta falta le hace. El sueño es  seguir trabajando en la agricultura.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Pedro Efrain is 41 years old. He is single and he lives at home with his parents in the city of Ventanas of the Rios province.

He is a member of the VRC San Francisco, which is located in the Pantano Precinct. It pertains to the Ventanas Canton. They make their living through agricultural and livestock work.

Pedro Efrain works in agriculture in planting corn. Also, he grows chickens and pigs. He is requesting the loan to buy chickens, seeds, urea, insecticides, herbicide, organic fertilizer, and balanced animal feed. 

With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he is lacking so much. The dream is to continue working in agriculture. 
The challenges that he faces are diseases. In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy chickens, seeds, urea, insecticides, herbicide, organic fertilizer, and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Consuelo Alejandrina

texts.es:
CONSUELO ALEJANDRINA tiene 34 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijas, vive con ellas en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincias de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.
